text: in many cases helped to carry them long distances, often under heavy fire. To him and all his
name: Real College Essays

text: helpers are due our grateful thanks for their work on that occasion.
name: Real College Essays

text: On relief we marched out to the Transport Lines behind Noyelles, where, in the early hours
name: Real College Essays

text: of October 16th, we got some most welcome and refreshing tea, supplied by Torrance and his
name: Real College Essays

text: followers, and then moved on, most of us more asleep than awake, to Vaudricourt, where we arrived
name: Real College Essays

text: about 6.30 a.m., and at once got down to sleep in some of the poorest billets it was ever our
name: Real College Essays

text: misfortune to strike.
name: Real College Essays

text: Thus ended the more or less fruitless battle of Hohenzollern Redoubt. Though we held a portion
name: Real College Essays

text: of the Redoubt as a result of the fighting, it was of no tactical value, and indeed later on
name: Real College Essays

text: was evacuated or blown up. The 12th Division fared no better, and we can only look back on
name: Real College Essays

text: the whole attack as, through no fault of our own, a dismal failure. The battle caused us enormous
name: Real College Essays

text: casualties, all to no purpose. Our Battalion alone lost seven Officers and 35 other ranks killed
name: Real College Essays

text: or died of wounds, three Officers and 132 other ranks wounded, and 14 missing, all of whom
name: Real College Essays

text: were afterwards found to have been killed. Amongst the casualties were Sergt. H. Hall, killed,
name: Real College Essays

text: and Sergts. Archer, Burn, Barrow, and I. B. Bell and Corpl. Bruerton wounded.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was a pleasure to all to hear a little later that for his gallantry and splendid work in
name: Real College Essays

text: this attack, and on many other occasions, "Pat" Ashwell was awarded a well-deserved D.S.O.
name: Real College Essays

text: At 5.0 p.m. on the afternoon of October 17th, the whole Battalion and many Officers of the
name: Real College Essays

text: Brigade and Division, attended the funeral of our beloved Colonel in the English cemetery,
name: Real College Essays

text: under the Church at Fouqui?res, the service being taken by his old friend Padre Hales. Some
name: Real College Essays

text: 18 months afterwards the Battalion arrived in billets six miles away from this spot, after
name: Real College Essays

text: a long and tiring march. They were expected to move into the line the next day, and some Officers
name: Real College Essays

text: who were lucky enough to be mounted, rode over to see the Colonel's grave. Around the grave,
name: Real College Essays

text: which had been carefully looked after by the Cur?? and other kind friends, and was covered with
name: Real College Essays

text: snowdrops and daffodils just in bloom, they found a number of the old Warrant Officers and
name: Real College Essays

text: N.C.O.'s of the Battalion paying a silent tribute to their old Commanding Officer. Such a tribute,
name: Real College Essays

text: surely is the finest testimonial to the character of a man who ever inspired in all ranks an
name: Real College Essays

text: affection and respect, which can never have been exceeded in any unit of the army.
name: Real College Essays

text: We were now little more than a skeleton of a Battalion, so that the arrival of 103 reinforcements,
name: Real College Essays

text: including Sergt. E. E. Deverall, was very welcome, but so far as Officers were concerned we
name: Real College Essays

text: remained for the moment very depleted. Capt. Turner remained in command of B Company; Lieut.
name: Real College Essays

text: E. M. Hacking took over A; Lieut. Abrams C, and Lieut. Gray D.
name: Real College Essays

text: Major-General Stuart-Wortley came to see us on October 18th, when the Battalion paraded in
name: Real College Essays

text: a field just outside Vaudricourt, and thanked us for our work in the battle, and spoke to a
name: Real College Essays

text: few of the N.C.O.'s and men, whose names had been forwarded as having done specially well.
name: Real College Essays

text: The following day we were not sorry to leave our wretched billets and march to Lapugnoy, where
name: Real College Essays

text: we got very comfortable quarters, and stayed for a week. Here we were able to do a little reorganising,
name: Real College Essays

text: and were fortunate in getting several new subalterns, viz.: 2nd Lieuts. A. Andrews, H. R. Peerless,
name: Real College Essays

text: who shortly became Battalion Grenade Officer, F. E. Kebblewhite, C. H. Powell, A. H. G. Cox,
name: Real College Essays

text: E. Hopkinson (formerly Comp. Sergt.-Major of C Company) and H. B. Hammond. With their welcome
name: Real College Essays

text: arrival. Companies got more or less into shape. We were unfortunate in having to send a large
name: Real College Essays

text: party by 'bus one day to Sailly Labourse, to help to fetch out the empty gas cylinders from
name: Real College Essays

text: the Hohenzollern trenches, but on the whole the few days spent at Lapugnoy were very pleasant.
name: Real College Essays

text: The "Whizzbangs" were in the same village, and gave several good shows, which after our recent
name: Real College Essays

text: gruelling were very refreshing, the more so as on this occasion they were assisted by two French
name: Real College Essays

text: ladies, who, needless to say, added enormously to the attraction.
name: Real College Essays

text: The "Vin blink" of Lapugnoy was also most attractive, and apparently rather more than usually
name: Real College Essays

text: potent, for it was undoubtedly the cause of casualties amongst all ranks. We left there on
name: Real College Essays

text: October 26th, and marched to B??thune, where we were again fortunate in being comfortably billeted
name: Real College Essays

text: at the Orphanage, with Officers' billets and Headquarters' Mess in the Rue de Lille.
name: Real College Essays

text: Two days later, on October 28th, a review of troops of the XI Corps, was held by the King and
name: Real College Essays

text: the Prince of Wales at Hesdigneul. Representatives of all units of the 46th Division were included
name: Real College Essays

text: in the parade, to which we contributed a composite Company of six Officers and 250 other ranks,
name: Real College Essays

text: under Capt. Davenport. The parade ground was a newly ploughed field, and as for several days
name: Real College Essays

text: previously there had been heavy rain the conditions were extremely unfavourable. After taking
name: Real College Essays

text: the salute, the King went on to inspect another unit in an adjoining field, where, unfortunately,
name: Real College Essays

text: he had a nasty accident, and the last we saw of him was driving away from the parade ground
name: Real College Essays

text: and looking very ill.
name: Real College Essays

text: Further reinforcements joined us at B??thune, mostly from entrenching Battalions, making our
name: Real College Essays

text: strength up to more normal figures, though for many months to come, we seldom exceeded 600
name: Real College Essays

text: to 700 all told. Capt. Hill was appointed to command D Company, 2nd Lieut. Cox succeeding him
name: Real College Essays

text: as Signalling Officer. Mounteney rejoined and resumed his duties as Regimental Sergt.-Major.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our next move was to the Richebourg sector--probably the most miserable trenches we ever met
name: Real College Essays

text: with, and then held by Indian troops. Leaving B??thune on November 4th, we proceeded via Epinette,
name: Real College Essays

text: where we spent one night, to Vieille Chapelle and relieved the 58th Rifles (Meerut Division)
name: Real College Essays

text: in front line trenches on November 6th, with Battalion Headquarters in "Edward Road," just
name: Real College Essays

text: behind Richebourg L'Avou??, and the front line a little in front of that village, and just South
name: Real College Essays

text: of Neuve Chapelle. This was a bad country for trenches, being flat and low lying, with the
name: Real College Essays

text: water level even at normal times very near the surface. The Boche as usual had such high ground
name: Real College Essays

text: as there was. This was mainly in the region of the Bois du Biez on our left, from which he
name: Real College Essays

text: got a fair view over much of our area. The Indians had done little trench work, and all that
name: Real College Essays

text: was taken over was a very poor front line, with a few scraps of support trenches, and one or
name: Real College Essays

text: two communication trenches, mostly full of water. It was during our first tour that a waggish
name: Real College Essays

text: Hun called out one night, after one of our Very lights had made rather a worse display than
name: Real College Essays

text: usual, "Better luck next time. I'll shew you how to send them "--which he promptly did, adding
name: Real College Essays

text: later, "I don't want to fight, I've had enough of the war." Towards the end of our stay in
name: Real College Essays

text: this area, we came across another talkative lot of Boches, who had a good deal to say one night,
name: Real College Essays

text: enquiring what regiment we were, and making various remarks about cigarettes and plum puddings.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was towards the end of our first tour that we had the first of our happily few casualties
name: Real College Essays

text: in this area, Lieut. Houfton being killed early in the morning of November 11th. He was endeavouring
name: Real College Essays

text: to make his way with Lieut. Abrams along an absolutely water-logged trench to "Boar's Head,"
name: Real College Essays

text: the extreme right of our Battalion sector, and they were evidently being carefully watched
name: Real College Essays

text: by a Boche sniper, who was doubtless able from time to time to catch a glimpse of their caps
name: Real College Essays

text: above the parapet. Eventually, when they got to a spot where the parapet was particularly low,
name: Real College Essays

text: he fired, the bullet killing Houfton, and passing through the peak of Abrams' cap. Sergt. T.
name: Real College Essays

text: Martin gallantly went to Houfton's aid, across 400 yards of very difficult and exposed ground.
name: Real College Essays

text: The front we held was changed somewhat after a time, and we side-stepped to the left, with
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion Headquarters in dug-outs, at the side of the Rue du Bois. The few odd houses left
name: Real College Essays

text: along this road were mostly used by the Gunners as observation posts, the principal being "Ritz,"
name: Real College Essays

text: Carlton, "Princes," and "Trocadero," and as the Boche gunners probably had a very shrewd
name: Real College Essays

text: suspicion of this, the neighbourhood of the road was often not a healthy spot, and on one or
name: Real College Essays

text: two occasions was shelled fairly heavily. It was on one of these, when we had some men wounded
name: Real College Essays

text: near "Factory Corner," that Pvte. Redfern, the old bandsman, coolly went to their aid in the
name: Real College Essays

text: midst of the shelling, and was dressing one of the men when he was himself mortally wounded.
name: Real College Essays

text: L.-Corpls. W. H. Lacey and S. Matthews also shewed great bravery in rescuing wounded men at
name: Real College Essays

text: the same time. In connection with this shelling of areas behind the front line, a somewhat
name: Real College Essays

text: unhappily worded order was received to the effect that daily reports frequently omitted to
name: Real College Essays

text: mention the activities of hostile artillery, and that as an example at a certain time on a
name: Real College Essays

text: certain day, "Guards Trench" was subjected to a sharp bombardment, and that had it not been
name: Real College Essays

text: for the fact that "a Staff Officer was accidentally in the front line at the time," nothing
name: Real College Essays

text: would have been known of this at Divisional Headquarters!
name: Real College Essays

text: The Boche machine gunners gave us a certain amount of trouble too, particularly at night, when
name: Real College Essays

text: they regularly sprayed all the area from the Rue du Bois to "Windy Corner," doubtless hoping
name: Real College Essays

text: to catch transport and carrying parties. One particular artiste used to try to play tunes with
name: Real College Essays

text: his gun and we had no difficulty in recognising his favourite as an attempt at "Yip-y-addy."
name: Real College Essays

text: It was a very unlucky burst from one of these one night that killed that very brave soldier
name: Real College Essays

text: Sergt. Sheppard, who had previously been awarded the D.C.M. for gallantry at Hooge. Lieut.
name: Real College Essays

text: Adams, our machine gun Officer, did his best to get his own back against them, and used to
name: Real College Essays

text: stalk out nightly alone, contrary to all regulations, and fire off his guns at odd times in
name: Real College Essays

text: the hope of catching someone. He was rewarded one night, after patiently lying in wait for
name: Real College Essays

text: a search light that the enemy had used occasionally from their front line parapet, by knocking
name: Real College Essays

text: it out with a burst of fire almost the instant it shewed itself. But on the whole there was
name: Real College Essays

text: very little excitement; in fact, we hardly had time for much, as we only spent a total of 16
name: Real College Essays

text: days in the trenches here altogether. Cold winter weather had set in, and there was little
name: Real College Essays

text: or no comfort possible for the men holding the front line. It was here that we first really
name: Real College Essays

text: found it necessary to use "gumboots thigh" when they could be got, and to dress legs and feet
name: Real College Essays

text: daily with whale oil to try and ward off that horrid complaint "trench feet," which might easily
name: Real College Essays

text: have caused many casualties in such trenches as these. A most complicated form had to be filled
name: Real College Essays

text: up with every case sent down to hospital suffering from trench foot, and no mercy was shewn
name: Real College Essays

text: to any Commanding Officer who did not take every precaution to prevent it. Fortunately we had
name: Real College Essays

text: a very good record. Every effort was made to relieve the men in the front line every 24 hours,
name: Real College Essays

text: and to take them back as often as possible to the billets near Windy Corner, where they were
name: Real College Essays

text: able to get their clothes dried, and a good night's rest before going back to the line.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our rest billets and Transport were at Vieille Chapelle. The field where the latter had their
name: Real College Essays

text: lines was nothing but a mass of mud, in most places knee-deep. The Transport at this time shewed
name: Real College Essays

text: remarkable activity, limbers going backwards and forwards all day to Lacouture on some mysterious
name: Real College Essays

text: duty, which was by no means unconnected with the excitement which arose in "A" Branch of Divisional
name: Real College Essays

text: Headquarters towards the end of our stay, about some houses missing from that village! They
name: Real College Essays

text: had been removed piecemeal to the transport lines, where they were used to form standings.
name: Real College Essays

text: During one tour spent in Brigade support, Battalion Headquarters and two Companies were in
name: Real College Essays

text: that village, and two Companies in billets in Richebourg St. Vaast, or finding garrisons for
name: Real College Essays

text: St. Vaast, "Grotto" and "Angle" posts. An interesting discovery in the rafters of a ruined
name: Real College Essays

text: house at Richebourg St. Vaast was a pepper box found to contain several gold louis. Capt. E.
name: Real College Essays

text: M. Hacking was the means of their being handed over to the French authorities and, we hope,
name: Real College Essays

text: eventually restored to their owner. The billets at Lacouture were not very good, but we had
name: Real College Essays

text: a great find there in the shape of what had once been a billiard table in the remains of the
name: Real College Essays

text: Village Institute. At the same time curiously enough, and for some time afterwards, the Quarter-Master
name: Real College Essays

text: reported that the demand for green cloth for putting behind cap badges was extraordinarily small!
name: Real College Essays

text: The main drawback to our periods of rest was those wretched working parties, which seemed to
name: Real College Essays

text: pursue us everywhere. Here the work in hand was the building of a solid breastwork in continuation
name: Real College Essays

text: of Guards Trench, just East of the Rue du Bois. Two nights out of each four we were at rest,
name: Real College Essays

text: we had to send large parties to Richebourg to carry on this work, which was being done "by
name: Real College Essays

text: the piece." A certain number of sandbags were issued to each man about half-a-mile before he
name: Real College Essays

text: got to his work, and he was told that when these had been filled and laid he could return.
name: Real College Essays

text: It is perhaps needless to say that many of the sandbags found a resting place in the nearest
name: Real College Essays

text: ditch, not far from the Royal Engineers' dump, where they were issued, and that the building
name: Real College Essays

text: of the breastwork did not proceed very rapidly.
name: Real College Essays

text: During our stay here several new Officers joined, including 2nd Lieuts. H. K. Simonet, G. A.
name: Real College Essays

text: P. Rawlings, and A. H. Michie from the 2/8th Battalion, and 2nd Lieuts. A. Bedford, G. G. Elliott,
name: Real College Essays

text: and W. W. Pitt. We were also given as Second-in-Command, Major E. H. Heathcote, from the 6th
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion, whilst his brother Capt. G. S. Heathcote, rejoined at the end of November and resumed
name: Real College Essays

text: command of C Company. At the same time Capt. E. M. Hacking went to Brigade Headquarters to
name: Real College Essays

text: learn Staff duties, leaving A Company under Lieut. Andrews, until taken over a little later
name: Real College Essays

text: by Capt. A. Hacking, who rejoined from Brigade. We also lost 2nd Lieut. Pickerell, who was
name: Real College Essays

text: invalided home. Our losses in other ranks during our stay amounted to three killed and 15 wounded.
name: Real College Essays

text: On December 2nd--we retain most pleasant memories of that night--we were relieved by the 7th
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion in the left sector, and on one of the darkest nights known, made our way back in
name: Real College Essays

text: the usual way to Vieille Chapelle. About 9.30 p.m. a message was received from Brigade that
name: Real College Essays

text: the Commanding Officer or Adjutant was wanted at once. The Adjutant was sent and came back
name: Real College Essays

text: with the news that we were to be "prepared to move at short notice to an unknown destination."
name: Real College Essays

text: At 5.0 a.m. the next morning further orders were received and we left Vieille Chapelle at noon
name: Real College Essays

text: the same day, marching via Merville to Haverskerque, where we got very good if scattered billets.
name: Real College Essays

text: There we proceeded to clean off some of the mud of the Richebourg trenches. During our march
name: Real College Essays

text: we met units of the 19th Division, moving up to relieve the troops in the trenches, and could
name: Real College Essays

text: not help feeling a touch of sympathy for them having been suddenly fetched away from comfortable
name: Real College Essays

text: billets, to take over such water-logged trenches, and we felt that for once fortune had favoured
name: Real College Essays

text: us.
name: Real College Essays

text: Rumours of all kinds began to float around, and of all quarters of the globe that were mentioned
name: Real College Essays

text: Egypt was believed to be "it," and it was not long before we found out that that indeed was
name: Real College Essays

text: our intended destination.
name: Real College Essays

text: Everyone was happy, and we were soon looking smart once more; in fact, so splendid was the
name: Real College Essays

text: effort at cleaning up, that the Battalion was congratulated by our Divisional Commander at
name: Real College Essays

text: his inspection on December 7th, as being the smartest Battalion of the eleven he had inspected.
name: Real College Essays

text: Odd men who had been detached for duty with other units rejoined. We had a few small drafts,
name: Real College Essays

text: and one new Officer, 2nd Lieut. W. H. B. Rezin.
name: Real College Essays

text: We now settled down for drill, interior economy, and lectures. Particular attention was given
name: Real College Essays

text: to guard drill and guard mounting ceremonies, as the Divisional Commander expressed a wish
name: Real College Essays

text: that we should turn out like the Guards Division, who were in the same Corps. Fur coats and
name: Real College Essays

text: other winter kit were handed in. A horrid pro forma certificate reached Orderly Room, and the
name: Real College Essays

text: Commanding Officer found he had to sign a certificate to the effect that the Battalion was
name: Real College Essays

text: in possession of every article enumerated in A.F.G. 1098 (Mobilisation Store Table). This document
name: Real College Essays

text: contained such items as "screws, brass, buckle roller 1 in. ? 7/8 in.--2" "awls, brad--1;"
name: Real College Essays

text: cordage, tarred spun yarn,--lbs. 14, and other luxuries which had long been considered superfluous,
name: Real College Essays

text: and mostly lost in the Salient. We had been told to indent for anything we wanted in the way
name: Real College Essays

text: of clothing or equipment, so that there was some consternation on the arrival of a new and
name: Real College Essays

text: fierce Deputy Assistant Director of Ordnance Services just at this moment, who told Quarter-Masters
name: Real College Essays

text: that during the last month, the whole of the Guards Division had not used the number of articles
name: Real College Essays

text: they were indenting for. Formal indents for "awls, brad," etc., were therefore out of the question.
name: Real College Essays

text: The Quarter-Master accused the Transport Officer, and the Transport Officer accused the Quarter-Master,
name: Real College Essays

text: but in the end the mess cart, which had a good cover, was requisitioned, and made two or three
name: Real College Essays

text: secret journeys by night to Merville, and when surprise was expressed that everything on the
name: Real College Essays

text: Mobilisation Store Table was present, both the individuals concerned looked supremely innocent,
name: Real College Essays

text: and no more was said about it. It has since transpired that a jar of rum played a prominent
name: Real College Essays

text: part in this incident.
name: Real College Essays

text: Here we parted with "Big Ben," "Old Bob," and other heavy draught horses, which had been with
name: Real College Essays

text: us since leaving Newark, and received in exchange mules from the Guards Divisional Ammunition
name: Real College Essays

text: Column, two of which rejoiced in the aristocratic names of "Harry Thaw," and "Legs Eleven."
name: Real College Essays

text: We were inspected by the Assistant Director of Medical Services; we had lectures on "Duties
name: Real College Essays

text: on board ship" and "Entraining." Special short leave was granted to a few lucky ones, and all
name: Real College Essays

text: preparations were made for a big move. Our billets were very comfortable. We could get good
name: Real College Essays

text: dinners at the "Corner Caf??," and those of us who were there, will never forget the wonderful
name: Real College Essays

text: concert given by the 19th Divisional Ammunition Column who were billeted there, in which two
name: Real College Essays

text: ladies from Merville assisted.
name: Real College Essays

text: On December 19th, we marched to Wittes, a small village on the La Bass??e Canal, near Aire.
name: Real College Essays

text: This was a short march on a bright Sunday morning, chiefly memorable for a wonderful equestrian
name: Real College Essays

text: feat on the part of a certain Company Commander, who went with his horse into a dyke at the
name: Real College Essays

text: starting point, and instead of coming out with the animal, stayed in by himself, and for the
name: Real College Essays

text: fact that an unfortunate mistake in map reading, caused the Battalion to perform a most startling
name: Real College Essays

text: and snake-like turning feat in a lane only a few feet wide, the mistake being discovered just
name: Real College Essays

text: as the last transport vehicle had entered the lane. However, as it was a bright day and we
name: Real College Essays

text: were going away, great good humour prevailed, and each Company played "Here we go round the
name: Real College Essays

text: water cart" in its own good time, and the tangle was soon sorted out.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our before breakfast parade at Wittes on a few occasions took the novel form of the whole Battalion
name: Real College Essays

text: doubling up and down along the Canal side to the accompaniment of the drums. This was entertaining
name: Real College Essays

text: for a brief space, but the novelty soon wore off. Ordinary training was continued, and included
name: Real College Essays

text: several route marches. It was during one of these that the C Company "wag" brought forth a
name: Real College Essays

text: spontaneous remark one day when passing one of those little dog-carts one used to see so often.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was very heavily laden and the dog was straining every nerve. A big, powerful looking woman
name: Real College Essays

text: was walking at the side carrying a horse whip, but taking no share in the burden. As the Company
name: Real College Essays

text: passed, our friend remarked "Eh, mum, you've forgotten your spurs!"
name: Real College Essays

text: Christmas, 1915, spent at Wittes was a very cheery one. All sorts of good things had been received
name: Real College Essays

text: from home, including a present for every Officer and man from the Nottingham Comforts Fund,
name: Real College Essays

text: and altogether we had a most enjoyable time. Football matches and sports of all kinds were
name: Real College Essays

text: indulged in, and one has vivid recollections of Sergt. Deverall giving a wonderful boxing display,
name: Real College Essays

text: and of a poor Frenchman waking up one morning to find his best wagon at the bottom of the Canal.
name: Real College Essays

text: [Illustrated: MAJOR J. P. BECHER, D.S.O. Died of wounds, Jan. 1st, 1916.]
name: Real College Essays

text: On Boxing-Day we marched via Aire to fresh billets at Molinghem, which were probably the most
name: Real College Essays

text: verminous we ever found. In spite of this drawback we had a very good time, and on January
name: Real College Essays

text: 6th, 1916, had the pleasure of welcoming the 11th Sherwood Foresters, who marched over from
name: Real College Essays

text: a neighbouring village and played us at football. After a good game we beat them by two goals
name: Real College Essays

text: to one. A Brigade inter-Battalion football competition was also played, in which after beating
name: Real College Essays

text: the 5th Battalion one--none, and the 7th Battalion three--none, we won the Brigade championship
name: Real College Essays

text: and some very neat medals.
name: Real College Essays

text: Whilst at Molinghem, we got our long expected orders to move South, and on January 7th, A and
name: Real College Essays

text: C Companies, and half the First Line Transport vehicles, under Major E. H. Heathcote entrained
name: Real College Essays

text: at Berguette, and were followed by the remainder of the Battalion on January 9th, except the
name: Real College Essays

text: horses, which were entrained at Lillers on January 11th. Eventually, after a train journey
name: Real College Essays

text: of nearly three days, the Battalion was concentrated at Marseilles, where after some rearranging,
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion Headquarters and B and D Companies were billeted at Camp Moussot, and A and C Companies
name: Real College Essays

text: under Major Heathcote, at Camp Borely.
name: Real College Essays

text: At Marseilles we spent what was probably our happiest fortnight in France. It is not difficult
name: Real College Essays

text: to imagine the pleasure everyone experienced at being transported to the shores of the Mediterranean
name: Real College Essays

text: in January after the filth and mud in the trenches, and wet and fogs of Northern France. The
name: Real College Essays

text: change was marvellous, and the turnout and appearance of the men splendid, and indeed the subject
name: Real College Essays

text: of comment by English people arriving from abroad, who said they could not help being struck
name: Real College Essays

text: on landing at finding the place full of well set-up and healthy English Tommies. Truly the
name: Real College Essays

text: change was delightful, though the Officers who had the misfortune to be billeted for a time
name: Real College Essays

text: in the draughty bathing establishment opposite Borely Camp, are not likely to forget the cold
name: Real College Essays

text: nights they spent there. Sea bathing, which we got almost next door to the Camp, was a great
name: Real College Essays

text: delight, and of course the town itself was full of attractions. We need only mention such names
name: Real College Essays

text: as the Cannibi?re, Theresa's Bar, Lindens, The Alcazar, Castell Muro, The Palais Crystal, The
name: Real College Essays

text: Bodega, and The Novelty, to recall many incidents to all those who were fortunate enough to
name: Real College Essays

text: be with us. It was certainly delightful, but played havoc with our banking accounts, and must
name: Real College Essays

text: have given Mr. Cox a very busy time. We did a certain amount of training in our more serious
name: Real College Essays

text: moments, which were not many, ordinary work normally finishing about 1.0 p.m., and the men
name: Real College Essays

text: being allowed out from 2.0 p.m. onwards. Many guards and camp and town fatigues had to be found,
name: Real College Essays

text: however, almost daily, which much depleted our numbers on parade. Training was mainly of the
name: Real College Essays

text: barrack square type. There was a certain amount of interest for those at Moussot Camp, in watching
name: Real College Essays

text: the Indian Troops, whilst those at Borely spent much time either in dodging the loose horses
name: Real College Essays

text: and mules, which wandered at will about the Camp, or the Camp Commandant, who had a violent
name: Real College Essays

text: dislike to orange peel, and if he found any at once arrested the nearest man, whether guilty
name: Real College Essays

text: or not!
name: Real College Essays

text: Four new Officers joined us there, viz., 2nd Lieuts. C. G. Tomlinson, E. C. Marshall, A. A.
name: Real College Essays

text: Hodgson, and W. S. Jones, and a draft of 39 men, all of whom no doubt thought it a very "bon" war.
name: Real College Essays

text: Plans for our sea journey had got so far advanced that our transport vehicles had actually
name: Real College Essays

text: been taken down to the docks for loading, when, alas for us, our hopes of going East were shattered
name: Real College Essays

text: on January 24th, by the receipt of orders to entrain the next night.
name: Real College Essays

text: What exactly caused the sudden change of plans we did not know at the time, but subsequently
name: Real College Essays

text: heard it was due to the unexpected ease with which Gallipoli had been evacuated. Needless to
name: Real College Essays

text: say there was much regret on all sides, especially when we found that we were to go back to
name: Real College Essays

text: the North of France and join the Third Army on the Western Front. On the evening of the 25th
name: Real College Essays

text: January, we marched down through cheering crowds of French people to the Gare d'Arenc, where
name: Real College Essays

text: after waiting about for four hours, we entrained at 4.10 a.m. on the 26th. It is sad to think
name: Real College Essays

text: that this wait gave an opportunity once more for light-fingered people in the Transport Section
name: Real College Essays

text: to annex eight or nine P.L.M. goods sheets, which were carefully stowed away, one on each limber,
name: Real College Essays

text: and later proved of great value in several places where there was a scarcity of billets.
name: Real College Essays

text: We detrained at Pont Remy on the morning of January 28th, after a peculiarly uncomfortable
name: Real College Essays

text: journey, and owing to our guide preferring to go three miles uphill to one on the flat our
name: Real College Essays

text: march to Ergnies was a somewhat lengthy business. In this area we followed the Ulster Division,
name: Real College Essays

text: and we are glad to add that the billets taken over from them were invariably scrupulously clean,
name: Real College Essays

text: and had evidently been vastly improved under their able medical authorities. We stayed here
name: Real College Essays

text: for several days, and had an opportunity of resting the men after their long journey, and of
name: Real College Essays

text: carrying out a little training. Some of this was in preparation for a Brigade ceremonial parade,
name: Real College Essays

text: which took place on February 3rd, when General Shipley spoke of the splendid work done by the
name: Real College Essays

text: Brigade in France up to that time, and read out a list of the honours and decorations awarded,
name: Real College Essays

text: of which we had had a fair share. At Ergnies we had flying visits from Col. Huskinson and "Doc."
name: Real College Essays

text: Stallard, both of whom we were delighted to see looking very fit.
name: Real College Essays

text: On February 10th, we marched to Ribeaucourt, where we stayed for a little over a week. Here
name: Real College Essays

text: on February 16th, we parted with Lieut. Adams, 2nd Lieut. Rezin, and 35 N.C.O.'s and men of
name: Real College Essays

text: the Machine Gun Section, who went to form part of the newly created "Brigade Machine Gun Company."
name: Real College Essays

text: In place of the Vickers gun thus withdrawn, we were issued with the new light Lewis Machine
name: Real College Essays

text: Gun, air cooled, mounted on a bipod and easily carried. Each Company had two of these and the
name: Real College Essays

text: whole were supervised by a Battalion Lewis Gun Officer, 2nd Lieut. Simonet being the first
name: Real College Essays

text: to be appointed to this duty. Musketry was carried out on a 300 yard range, which we fitted
name: Real College Essays

text: up near the village, and bombing practice under the guidance of 2nd Lieut. Peerless, who made
name: Real College Essays

text: considerable progress in the use of the West Spring Thrower. Capt. A. Hacking had been again
name: Real College Essays

text: taken to Brigade Headquarters, to act as Grenade Officer, and Capt. Lawson who had rejoined
name: Real College Essays

text: at Wittes, was appointed to command A Company in his place. All this time we were well in the
name: Real College Essays

text: back regions out of harm's way. The only journey made to the front area was that by a party
name: Real College Essays

text: of Officers, who one day had to reconnoitre some reserve lines of trenches near Forceville
name: Real College Essays

text: and Mailly Maillet. We once had orders to be prepared to take over the line at Beaumont Hamel,
name: Real College Essays

text: but this fell through.
name: Real College Essays

text: Ribeaucourt we shall always remember, owing to the exorbitant claims made by the inhabitants
name: Real College Essays

text: for damage to billets. Never before nor after did we receive such demands as those made by
name: Real College Essays

text: the good people of that village, headed by the Maire, who after showing much hospitality to
name: Real College Essays

text: a few of us, seemed to want to give the villagers a lead in their demands! How they were eventually
name: Real College Essays

text: settled we never found out. Here, too, Capt. Davenport and Sergt. Blunt were chased down the
name: Real College Essays

text: village street one day by two infuriated women armed with broomsticks, their store of bully
name: Real College Essays

text: beef and army shirts having been discovered by the former, when looking for odds and ends to
name: Real College Essays

text: hand into the Deputy Assistant Director of Ordnance Services in exchange for new articles.
name: Real College Essays

text: The D.A.D.O.S. had just issued an ultimatum to the effect that he would issue nothing except
name: Real College Essays

text: on the return of the old article. Transport men, therefore, scoured the country side for bottoms
name: Real College Essays

text: of nose-bags, backs of dandy brushes, pieces of rope, etc., which were cleaned and handed in
name: Real College Essays

text: and quite a good stock of new articles was obtained in return.
name: Real College Essays

text: On February 20th, we were taken in motor 'buses by a somewhat circuitous route to fresh billets
name: Real College Essays

text: at Candas, where we stayed until March 6th. Most of this time the weather was extremely cold
name: Real College Essays

text: and there were several heavy snowstorms. Navvying on new railways was our chief work, under
name: Real College Essays

text: the supervision of the 112th Company Royal Engineers, either about Puchevillers, or the station
name: Real College Essays

text: at Candas, in preparation for the offensive that was to take place later on. Our fortnight
name: Real College Essays

text: at Candas completed three whole months of what was practically "rest" in the back areas. We
name: Real College Essays

text: were now to play a more active part in the war.
name: Real College Essays

text: Vimy Ridge will always bring up in the minds of those of the 8th Sherwood Foresters, who were
name: Real College Essays

text: with us at that time the word "Mines." Everyone seemed somehow or other to have heard that
name: Real College Essays

text: that part of the line was famous for mining warfare, and as the news was passed on from one
name: Real College Essays

text: to another that Vimy Ridge was our destination, a kind of whisper of "Mines" passed with it.
name: Real College Essays

text: The area proved to be a mass of mines, and we found that mining warfare was extremely unpleasant,
name: Real College Essays

text: though most of our own experience was confined to the latter part of our stay there.
name: Real College Essays

text: The front line in this sector, in the early part of 1915 had run through the East end of the
name: Real College Essays

text: Lorette Ridge to Carency, and thence to La Targette, but on September 25th of that year, the
name: Real College Essays

text: French had driven the enemy back nearly a mile, practically to the foot of the Vimy Ridge itself.
name: Real College Essays

text: In this area were portions of the front having such well-known names as "The Labyrinth," and
name: Real College Essays

text: Souchez Sugar Refinery--reminders of the fact that some of the most savage fighting of the
name: Real College Essays

text: whole war took place there, owing to the struggle of the enemy to retain a footing on that
name: Real College Essays

text: splendid line of observation, the Lorette Ridge. The Arras-B??thune Road, known as the Route
name: Real College Essays

text: de B??thune, and bordered by a few scraggy trees, ran through the sector more or less from North
name: Real College Essays

text: to South--about a mile behind the front line, and two miles in front of Mont St. Eloy. The
name: Real College Essays

text: forward area was a scene of desolation--trenches and wire, shell-holes everywhere, mine craters
name: Real College Essays

text: here and there, shewing more or less where No Man's Land was, and beyond them the gently sloping
name: Real College Essays

text: ridge, with little variation except a few shattered trees marking the site of La Folie Wood.
name: Real College Essays

text: Such was the sector that our advance party of Officers went up to reconnoitre on March 5th.
name: Real College Essays

text: The French were holding the line, and this was the Battalion's only experience of taking over
name: Real College Essays

text: from them. We were not let into the secret of the why and wherefore of the move, but doubtless
name: Real College Essays

text: we relieved in order to allow them to send much wanted help to their friends at Verdun, who
name: Real College Essays

text: were now so hard pressed owing to the enemy's continued attacks. It was hoped that the fact
name: Real College Essays

text: of our taking over this part of the line could be kept from the Boche, at least until relief
name: Real College Essays

text: was complete, and to further this object the advance party were given French "tin hats" to
name: Real College Essays

text: wear so as to maintain the deception. We fear that despite our efforts, the enemy knew just
name: Real College Essays

text: about as much of the relief as we did, and rumour says that a Boche scout, on getting across
name: Real College Essays

text: to the French front line two days before we relieved them, openly expressed his surprise to
name: Real College Essays

text: the French sentry that the English had not already arrived! We were shewn the greatest kindness
name: Real College Essays

text: by the French when we went up to reconnoitre, and they did all they could to explain the situation,
name: Real College Essays

text: and many an Officer drank confusion to the enemy in a glass of sweet sparkling wine. Those
name: Real College Essays

text: who were there will doubtless well remember the group of Officers being assembled just behind
name: Real College Essays

text: the Arras-B??thune road, in full view of the German lines, under the French Brigade Major, who
name: Real College Essays

text: was acting as guide, when the Hun gunners, not being able to let such an opportunity slip,
name: Real College Essays

text: at once put over a few "pip-squeaks," and we discovered with a considerable amount of pleasure,
name: Real College Essays

text: that our gallant Allies were just about as good in getting to ground as ourselves, if not a
name: Real College Essays

text: trifle better. It was, however, a rude awakening to the fact that a war was still on, which
name: Real College Essays

text: we had rather forgotten during our stay in the South of France, and in the back areas.
name: Real College Essays

text: Leaving Candas on March 6th, we marched on a very snowy day, via Doullens, to Iverny, moving
name: Real College Essays

text: on the 8th to Maizi?res, and on the 9th to Acq, where we had to make the best of most uncomfortable
name: Real College Essays

text: billets, the whole village being a seething mass of troops, French and English, and every billet
name: Real College Essays

text: crowded to its utmost limit. On the occasion of this move we marched, in accordance with instructions,
name: Real College Essays

text: in column of three's. This system was tried owing to the narrow roads, but only lasted a few
name: Real College Essays

text: months.
name: Real College Essays

text: On the following day we moved up into support trenches, just in front of the Route de B??thune,
name: Real College Essays

text: where we stayed for four days cleaning trenches, carrying out general trench repairs, and improving
name: Real College Essays

text: dug-outs. There were a certain number of deep dug-outs in this sector--our first experience
name: Real College Essays

text: of them--proof against all but the heaviest shells, though in every other respect a bad invention.
name: Real College Essays

text: Further behind, at Berthonval Farm, were huge caverns hewn out of the chalk, fitted up with
name: Real College Essays

text: wire beds, absolutely shell-proof, and having accommodation for about two Companies. The dug-outs
name: Real College Essays

text: in the front line trenches, however, were mere shelters. Later on we were told to make our
name: Real College Essays

text: shelters in this area of a uniform pattern in small saps running back from the trenches, and
name: Real College Essays

text: when men could be spared from other more pressing work, a certain amount of progress was made
name: Real College Essays

text: in this respect.
name: Real College Essays

text: The French dug-outs possessed one unique quality; they were decorated as only a Frenchman could
name: Real College Essays

text: decorate them, with most wonderful designs in pokerwork, which were always objects of the greatest
name: Real College Essays

text: interest to our visitors.
name: Real College Essays

text: On March 15th, we were relieved by the 2nd Royal Irish Rifles, and withdrew for four days to
name: Real College Essays

text: rest billets, which consisted of some French huts partly in the wood, and partly in the open,
name: Real College Essays

text: just behind Mont St. Eloy. We are afraid we could not have given our predecessors a "billet
name: Real College Essays

text: clean" certificate in respect of these huts, many of which were a foot or more deep with accumulated
name: Real College Essays

text: rubbish of every description. There were no baths, and we had to rig up home-made ones with
name: Real College Essays

text: ground sheets and other means, using the cookers for providing the necessary hot water. We
name: Real College Essays

text: managed, however, to get clean clothing from time to time from the Staff Captain, Major Wordsworth,
name: Real College Essays

text: who got together a fascinating crowd of French ladies, and did much useful work as Officer
name: Real College Essays

text: Commanding Laundry, at Mont St. Eloy.
name: Real College Essays

text: We were at this time called upon to provide a contribution towards the Brigade Mining Section,
name: Real College Essays

text: which was re-formed to help the French Miners in the sector, and on March 17th, we had to part
name: Real College Essays

text: temporarily with Lieut. R. V. Harvey, Corpl. Boot and 12 men, who joined the Brigade Section
name: Real College Essays

text: under Lieut. Webster, of the Robin Hoods. The arrival of 140 reinforcements the previous day
name: Real College Essays

text: had, however, swelled our numbers considerably, amongst several old friends in the draft being
name: Real College Essays

text: Sergt. G. Powell, who shortly became Comp. Sergt.-Major of A Company, Sergts. I. B. Bell, S.
name: Real College Essays

text: Foster, Collins and Beniston, and Corpl. A. B. North. We thus had a reasonable trench strength
name: Real College Essays

text: when we relieved the 7th Battalion in the left sub-sector on March 19th.
name: Real College Essays

text: In this area we always kept to the same sub-sector, relieving as on many other occasions with
name: Real College Essays

text: the Robin Hoods. The 5th and 6th Battalions shared the right sub-sector, whilst the 138th Brigade
name: Real College Essays

text: were on our left. Each Company, too, had its own section of trench, finding its own supports.
name: Real College Essays

text: From right to left they ran in order: D (Capt. Hill), B (Capt. Turner), C (Major G. S. Heathcote),
name: Real College Essays

text: A (Capt. Vann, who had recently rejoined; during his absence on a course at 3rd Army School,
name: Real College Essays

text: his place was taken by Capt. Lawson). Battalion Headquarters was in a delightful spot just
name: Real College Essays

text: under the steep side of the Talus des Zouaves, and well nigh out of reach of everything but
name: Real College Essays

text: aeroplane bombs. Second Lieut. Cox was Signalling Officer, 2nd Lieut. Simonet, Lewis Gun Officer,
name: Real College Essays

text: 2nd Lieut. Peerless, Grenade Officer, and 2nd Lieut. Marshall, Intelligence Officer. The last-named
name: Real College Essays

text: was the first Officer in the Battalion to hold that newly created appointment.
name: Real College Essays

text: The enemy front line was close to ours, in most parts about 70 yards away, but bombing posts
name: Real College Essays

text: in saps were in several cases not more than 10 to 15 yards apart. Talking and movement in the
name: Real College Essays

text: front line could often be heard quite plainly, whilst our Bombers in the posts used to indulge
name: Real College Essays

text: sometimes in lobbing practice, and spent their odd moments in erecting or repairing wire netting
name: Real College Essays

text: to catch the Boche "potato mashers."
name: Real College Essays

text: Our two communication trenches running forward--"Boyau Central" and "Avenue Lassale"--though
name: Real College Essays

text: well cared for and kept up by the French, were almost straight, and hardly traversed at all,
name: Real College Essays

text: particularly the former, and movement along them was precarious. The fire and support trenches,
name: Real College Essays

text: bearing such names as "Schiller," "Grange," "Broadmarsh," "Duffield," and "Bertrand," were
name: Real College Essays

text: in very bad order, and work was at once concentrated in an effort to make a good line of resistance
name: Real College Essays

text: along "Guerin Trench," practically the support line. Some work was also done on a reserve trench,
name: Real College Essays

text: known as "Blancheti?re." We felt this all the more necessary, as just before we took over from
name: Real College Essays

text: the French, the Boche had driven them out of their front line, and it seemed quite within the
name: Real College Essays

text: range of possibility that he might try to make a further advance. Our fears turned out to be
name: Real College Essays

text: correct, for later he did make an onslaught, though luckily not whilst we were there.
name: Real College Essays

text: Unfortunately the enemy in capturing the trenches, had secured the shafts of all the French
name: Real College Essays

text: mines, and had consequently got a good start at various points along the front before the French
name: Real College Essays

text: could begin again. The result was that practically all the French mines were defensive, and
name: Real College Essays

text: intended merely to try and blow the Germans, before they could get under our lines. No doubt
name: Real College Essays

text: each side knew almost exactly where the other side was working, and at what approximate time
name: Real College Essays

text: any particular mine would go up. These were all shewn to us on a plan, and carefully explained
name: Real College Essays

text: by the Officer in charge of the French Miners, who were still at work in the sector. Each Company
name: Real College Essays

text: had a cut-and-dried scheme for carrying out the instant a mine went up in its own or adjoining
name: Real College Essays

text: sectors. Anticipating the mine, parties were kept available to seize the near lip of the crater
name: Real College Essays

text: formed, with covering parties of Lewis gunners, riflemen, and bombers to go out on each flank,
name: Real College Essays

text: and working parties behind them to begin at once to dig a trench to join up the broken front
name: Real College Essays

text: line across the lip of the crater, wire the front and establish observation posts on the lip.
name: Real College Essays

text: All this work had to be started the instant the mine was exploded, in order to make certain
name: Real College Essays

text: that the Boche did not get possession of our lip of the crater, as well as his own. This entailed
name: Real College Essays

text: constant readiness and considerable anxiety on the part of those holding the front line.
name: Real College Essays

text: The enemy shewed no special activity, though on several occasions our front and support lines
name: Real College Essays

text: were badly knocked about, both by shells and trench mortars, which necessitated a vast amount
name: Real College Essays

text: of repairs, and caused us considerable casualties. In addition to high explosive he now began
name: Real College Essays

text: to send over for the first time "lachrymatory" gas shells, having a sweet smell and doing little
name: Real College Essays

text: harm except to make our eyes water. In the later stages of the war, they became, as we shall
name: Real College Essays

text: see, much more disagreeable.
name: Real College Essays

text: As it was so difficult in this sector for our Gunners to be able to identify our front line,
name: Real College Essays

text: we had to mark it with "artillery boards,"--white boards about 3 ft. by 2 ft., marked with
name: Real College Essays

text: different letters denoting the different sections of the front. These were stuck up by the
name: Real College Essays

text: Infantry at night, in such a position that they could be seen by our Gunners but be invisible
name: Real College Essays

text: to the enemy. Whether they were any real help or not is doubtful. Later on we were given a
name: Real College Essays

text: smaller portable type of board, coloured brown and marked with a black cross, a number of which
name: Real College Essays

text: were issued to each Battalion, and carried with us as part of our equipment. They were intended
name: Real College Essays

text: for use in moving warfare to mark our advanced positions, but were eventually discarded as
name: Real College Essays

text: unsuitable.
name: Real College Essays

text: We now began seriously to try and harass the enemy with trench mortars, for which purpose Trench
name: Real College Essays

text: Mortar Batteries were formed. The medium batteries fired a fairly heavy shell with a long tail
name: Real College Essays

text: (known as "Footballs" or "Toffee Apples"), and the Stokes batteries a light shell, which could
name: Real College Essays

text: be fired at the rate of 20 or more per minute. We had recently sent 2nd Lieut. Kebblewhite
name: Real College Essays

text: and five men to a school for a course in this work. It is feared, however, that the first efforts
name: Real College Essays

text: of the trench mortar experts in the trenches were not fully appreciated. A very nervous Officer
name: Real College Essays

text: would go to his emplacement, fire off a few shells, and then gracefully, but rapidly retire,
name: Real College Essays

text: leaving the people on the spot to put up with any retaliation. And we well remember Capt. Lawson
name: Real College Essays

text: being so annoyed at this going on, that on one occasion the bed plate mysteriously disappeared.
name: Real College Essays

text: On another occasion an emplacement was made one night with much care on D Company's front,
name: Real College Essays

text: ready for a big bombardment, but when completed was found to be in full view of six enemy sniper
name: Real College Essays

text: plates, about 100 yards away!
name: Real College Essays

text: At sniping we more than held our own, though the enemy were very keen, and used to fire from
name: Real College Essays

text: steel plates fixed round the mine craters. We were unfortunate in losing at this period Sergt.-Drummer
name: Real College Essays

text: Clewes, who went home for discharge. He had done much excellent work in charge of the Brigade
name: Real College Essays

text: Snipers, his own "bag" being stated to amount to considerably over 100. As some recognition
name: Real College Essays

text: of his good work he was later awarded the D.C.M. His son, Corpl. G. W. Clewes, another excellent
name: Real College Essays

text: sniper, left at the same time. L.-Corpl. Hagues took over the duties of N.C.O. in charge of
name: Real College Essays

text: Snipers, and with 2nd Lieut. Marshall, did some splendid work, including the blowing-in of
name: Real College Essays

text: several loophole plates with Col. Fowler's Elephant Gun, which was now brought into use again.
name: Real College Essays

text: Marshall's "pet," however, was the "dummy tree" on the Route de B??thune. This was a hollow
name: Real College Essays

text: tree about 20 feet high, formed of steel casing, and covered with imitation bark. Inside there
name: Real College Essays

text: were ledges to climb up by, and from it a most excellent view for a very long distance around,
name: Real College Essays

text: could be obtained. It had been erected by the enemy before they had been driven back.
name: Real College Essays

text: Another item in the "Intelligence Department" which now came into use, was that extraordinary
name: Real College Essays

text: instrument known as the "I-Tok," intended for picking up enemy telegraphic and telephonic messages.
name: Real College Essays

text: We never were supposed to know where its operators performed, and rarely did know, but more
name: Real College Essays

text: often than not they placed themselves near Battalion Headquarters, and the sheaves of papers
name: Real College Essays

text: they sent to Brigade were mostly filled with scraps of our own messages. It is doubtful if
name: Real College Essays

text: much of value was picked up from enemy messages, but they certainly did good in keeping a check
name: Real College Essays

text: on our own conversations over the telephone, and were regularly used from now onwards. The
name: Real College Essays

text: Fullerphone, which was introduced a little later, and largely superseded the ordinary telephone,
name: Real College Essays

text: was reputed to be capable of transmitting messages in such a way that they could not be picked up.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our Firework Artistes, too, decided that they ought to have a show, and accordingly arranged
name: Real College Essays

text: for us one night to have a display of red rockets in the front line. These rockets had been
name: Real College Essays

text: issued for use for night S.O.S. When the time came for them to be let off, the only visible
name: Real College Essays

text: result to those behind watching, was one feeble rocket which made a short lob, and fell to
name: Real College Essays

text: the earth. Only one other went off at all, and it had a great tussle with John Turner, nearly
name: Real College Essays

text: knocking him through a traverse, and then fizzing itself out in the bottom of the trench.
name: Real College Essays

text: Another brainy person, one of our German scholars, decided one day to try the result of putting
name: Real College Essays

text: up a placard to give the Boche the news that the L.15 had been sunk in the Thames. This was
name: Real College Essays

text: on April 2nd. Two days later a notice was put up opposite B Company's front, which said "Thanks
name: Real College Essays

text: for your news: you are all mad"--shewing, we thought, a lack of originality on his part. This
name: Real College Essays

text: was one of the very few occasions upon which we either sent or received a message in this way.
name: Real College Essays

text: Just about the same time, we had the pleasure of seeing a Hun plane brought down by one of
name: Real College Essays

text: our own, after a short sharp scrap in mid-air. Our man dived at the Hun and opened with Lewis
name: Real College Essays

text: gun fire, killing both the pilot and observer. The plane took charge of itself, and after a
name: Real College Essays

text: brief wild career, crashed near our Battalion Headquarters. It was no sooner down than it was
name: Real College Essays

text: shelled by the enemy and eventually set on fire. Various useful documents, however, were secured
name: Real College Essays

text: from it including some maps and a signalling code. The bodies of the pilot, Lieut. Ziemssen,
name: Real College Essays

text: and the observer were buried at Mont St. Eloy by Padre Hales, who a little later received an
name: Real College Essays

text: appreciative letter from the pilot's widow.
name: Real College Essays

text: With these and sundry other excitements, we got through two six-day tours in the line, and
name: Real College Essays

text: also spent two periods of similar length at our rest huts cleaning, training, and reorganising,
name: Real College Essays

text: for we were continually losing Officers and men in various ways, and fresh ones were joining.
name: Real College Essays

text: Amongst the former we lost 2nd Lieuts. G. G. Elliott and Pitt, invalided to England, and the
name: Real College Essays

text: following Warrant Officers and N.C.O.'s who left us on completion of their term of service:
name: Real College Essays

text: Regimental Quarter-Master Sergt. Tomlin, Comp. Sergt.-Major Haywood, Comp. Quarter-Master Sergt.
name: Real College Essays

text: Shelton, and Sergts. Murden, Handford and Kettle. Arrivals included Major Ashwell, Capt. H.
name: Real College Essays

text: Kirby, Lieut. G. Wright, 2nd Lieut. W. P. Duff, and about 70 men, many of whom were returned
name: Real College Essays

text: casualties, and in some cases anything but fit to resume active service. Comp. Quarter-Master
name: Real College Essays

text: Sergt. Dench became Regimental Quarter-Master Sergt., Sergt. Bee Comp. Quarter-Master Sergt.
name: Real College Essays

text: of B Company, and Sergt. Hotson Comp. Quarter-Master Sergt. of C Company.
name: Real College Essays

text: We were able to offer very little in the way of amusement just at this period, entertainers
name: Real College Essays

text: either being more or less non-existent, or somewhat shy. One afternoon, however, we succeeded
name: Real College Essays

text: in rousing sufficient enthusiasm to organise a boxing contest, one of the very few ever carried
name: Real College Essays

text: through by the Battalion. In the heavy-weight contest between those two stalwarts, Sergt. Slater
name: Real College Essays

text: and Corpl. Bryan, the latter retired after the third round with an injured hand. The middle-weight
name: Real College Essays

text: competition was won by Sergt. L. Green, and the lightweight by Sergt. Attenborough. The same
name: Real College Essays

text: evening, we managed an impromptu concert in one of the huts.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our Transport Lines and Quarter-Master's stores during this period were back at Acq, and were
name: Real College Essays

text: fairly comfortable. Here for the first time we had the experience of taking rations and stores
name: Real College Essays

text: up to the line on the light railways, already constructed by the French, a system of transport
name: Real College Essays

text: in which both they and the Germans were much ahead of us. Stores were unloaded from the limbers
name: Real College Essays

text: at Ecoivres on to flat trucks, each of which was pulled by three mules. The "Decauville Track"
name: Real College Essays

text: ran past "Berthonval Farm," across the B??thune road, branching there right and left for the
name: Real College Essays

text: various Battalion dumps, ours being in the Talus des Zouaves, near Battalion Headquarters.
name: Real College Essays

text: At first, the system did not work well, and there was much confusion, but later it was properly
name: Real College Essays

text: organised so that rations went up first, and Royal Engineers' stores about midnight. When we
name: Real College Essays

text: first took over the sector, the French caused much alarm to our men by carrying their stores
name: Real College Essays

text: to and from the B??thune Road by electric trucks, actually the chassis and platforms of trains
name: Real College Essays

text: from Paris Plage, to which the bells used for warning pedestrians were still attached. One
name: Real College Essays

text: brakesman, Alphonse by name, like a wise person, usually went about his own business on arrival
name: Real College Essays

text: at the B??thune Road Dump, which was often a warm spot. The driver meanwhile got his load to
name: Real College Essays

text: take back, and anxious as all were who ever had a job of work at that particular spot, to get
name: Real College Essays

text: it done and be off, he adopted the practice which seemed to us rather foolish, of vigorously
name: Real College Essays

text: sounding his gong time after time, at the same time shouting "Alphonse, Alphonse," with the
name: Real College Essays

text: result that all our men vanished "tout-de-suite," leaving him and the errant Alphonse to face
name: Real College Essays

text: any whizz-bangs which might result. Truly, the French are a remarkable race!
name: Real College Essays

text: We must, however, congratulate them on that excellent institution in the Vimy sector, Trench
name: Real College Essays

text: Coffee Shops. Where cooking for the trenches was a matter of some difficulty, as in this sector,
name: Real College Essays

text: it was a great boon to be able to get such excellent supplies of hot tea and other comforts
name: Real College Essays

text: as they provided. They were run by the French for some time after our arrival, but later were
name: Real College Essays

text: taken over by our own Brigade, and put under the care of Capt. E. M. Hacking, who was attached
name: Real College Essays

text: to Brigade Headquarters. We feel, however, we must attribute to the somewhat casual sanitary
name: Real College Essays

text: measures adopted by the French, the presence of so many rats in this sector. One often met
name: Real College Essays

text: them in droves in the trenches, and never before or after did we come across such numbers of
name: Real College Essays

text: the beasts, and such colossal specimens as we found during our stay in the Vimy trenches.
name: Real College Essays

text: On April 12th, after a brief inspection near our huts by Major-General Stuart-Wortley, we went
name: Real College Essays

text: up to the trenches for our last and most eventful tour, which was destined to last eight days.
name: Real College Essays

text: Owing to falls of snow and rain, the trenches were in a deplorable state, and gumboots were
name: Real College Essays

text: in great demand, and our only means of keeping the men at all dry. At this time we had no such
name: Real College Essays

text: luxuries as drying-rooms. Heavy shelling by the enemy during the first three days made things
name: Real College Essays

text: still more uncomfortable. The real business of the tour, however, began on April 16th, on which
name: Real College Essays

text: night the French had arranged to blow one mine on our front, and another on the front of the
name: Real College Essays

text: 6th Battalion. Combined with this we had arranged for a small raid to be carried out by Lieut.
name: Real College Essays

text: A. Bedford and 12 other ranks, who immediately the mines were exploded were to rush forward
name: Real College Essays

text: round the left edge of our crater, and endeavour to capture any Germans found in a small forward
name: Real College Essays

text: trench they had recently dug there. The mines were to go up at midnight, and at the same time
name: Real College Essays

text: our guns and trench mortars were to put down a barrage on the Boche trenches, which was to
name: Real College Essays

text: be augmented by rifle grenades and showers of grenades thrown from West Spring Throwers, under
name: Real College Essays

text: the arrangement of our Grenade Officer. Unfortunately, there had evidently been some bad synchronisation
name: Real College Essays

text: somewhere, for at five minutes before zero two Frenchmen suddenly came rushing towards Bedford,
name: Real College Essays

text: who was waiting in a communication trench with his party, shouting "Tout-de-suite! Tout-de-suite!"
name: Real College Essays

text: and almost at the same instant the mines went up. This was very unfortunate, as it enabled
name: Real College Essays

text: the Boche, who evidently knew all about it, to get their barrage down before our own Gunners,
name: Real College Essays

text: who were waiting for zero. Bedford at once pushed on with his party with much dash in face
name: Real College Essays

text: of heavy fire from machine guns, rifles, trench mortars and bombs. He got as far as the advanced
name: Real College Essays

text: trench, which, however, was held in considerable strength, and finding himself bombed on both
name: Real College Essays

text: sides, he had to withdraw without getting a prisoner. His party got back alright, but unfortunately
name: Real College Essays

text: Bedford himself was knocked down by a bomb, and although only slightly wounded had to leave
name: Real College Essays

text: us, and a few days later was invalided to England. Capt. Hill meanwhile carried out the consolidation
name: Real College Essays

text: with much success. As soon as the mass of d??bris, chalk and stones had stopped falling, parties
name: Real College Essays

text: at once got to work digging a new trench across the crater which was something like 30 yards
name: Real College Essays

text: wide by 30 feet deep, to connect the broken front line, establishing observation posts and
name: Real College Essays

text: putting out fresh wire. In spite of intense fire a sufficient trench had been dug by dawn,
name: Real College Essays

text: and the position made good. Great assistance was rendered by Capt. Gray and the N.C.O.'s of
name: Real College Essays

text: D Company. Unfortunately Sergt. Markham, after most gallantly controlling the fire of his platoon
name: Real College Essays

text: for nearly two hours, under very heavy fire, was shot through the head and killed instantly.
name: Real College Essays

text: Another excellent piece of work was performed by Pvte. E. Dobb, who leapt out of the trench
name: Real College Essays

text: on seeing a party of Huns trying to get round the crater, and hurled two bombs right amongst
name: Real College Essays

text: them. If they had had any doubts as to the possibility of getting round, this made up their
name: Real College Essays

text: minds, and they retired hurriedly.
name: Real College Essays

text: The following night at midnight, the enemy sprang a mine on the front of our left Company (A),
name: Real College Essays

text: which caused considerable trouble and heavy loss before the position was finally made good.
name: Real College Essays

text: A portion of our front line was blown up, and owing to the heavy state of the ground, which
name: Real College Essays

text: was much water-logged, and to the intense hostile bomb, rifle and machine gun fire, it was
name: Real College Essays

text: impossible to get a trench dug round our lip of the crater. It was not until three nights after
name: Real College Essays

text: that the situation was cleared, and our lip of the crater finally occupied, after some of the
name: Real College Essays

text: most difficult and miserable nights that it was ever our misfortune to experience. During these
name: Real College Essays

text: days there was little rest for anyone, and much excellent work was done by all ranks. Marshall
name: Real College Essays

text: carried out some splendid patrols, ably assisted by L.-Corpl. Hinchley, going out nightly through
name: Real College Essays

text: mud and filth, to ascertain the position around the crater. Duff did almost superhuman work
name: Real College Essays

text: with bombs and rifle grenades, being at it practically the whole night, for three nights in
name: Real College Essays

text: succession, and this was only his second tour in the trenches. The Stretcher Bearers too, as
name: Real College Essays

text: always, did most notable work, particularly Pvtes. Holbery and Thomas, who fetched in our wounded
name: Real College Essays

text: from the slopes of the crater only a few yards below and in full view of the German sentry
name: Real College Essays

text: post, whilst Sergts. Deverall and Collins, and L.-Corpl. Ostick also did very gallant work,
name: Real College Essays

text: and L.-Corpl. J. T. Templeman throughout carried out his work of repairing telephone wires,
name: Real College Essays

text: with his usual skill and courage. So uncanny was the work of this period, that Lieut. Peerless
name: Real College Essays

text: was able on one occasion to take deliberate aim, at 30 yards range, at a German digging hard
name: Real College Essays

text: in the bright moonlight, on the top of a crater.
name: Real College Essays

text: On April 19th, the French sprang another mine, just to the left of our Battalion front, as
name: Real College Essays

text: a result of which we got a certain amount of hostile shelling, whilst on the 20th, the enemy
name: Real College Essays

text: put up another, slightly to our left, which also brought its share of shelling on us. This,
name: Real College Essays

text: however, was our last, for much to our relief, and at comparatively short notice, the 10th
name: Real College Essays

text: Cheshires (25th Division) took over our sector on the night of the 20th, and after a weary
name: Real College Essays

text: trudge over that never-ending duck-board track, we got to Ecoivres by 1 a.m. on the 21st. Having
name: Real College Essays

text: done full justice to the excellent tea which the Quarter-Master and his followers had ready
name: Real College Essays

text: for us, we were taken in 'buses to Tincques, where we arrived about 6 a.m., and found that
name: Real College Essays

text: we were to be billeted partly there, and partly in the neighbouring village of Bethencourt.
name: Real College Essays

text: We fear we did not present a happy sight at that early hour to the ladies just going to church
name: Real College Essays

text: on a lovely Good Friday morning. Dawn is not an ideal time for seeing a Battalion at its best,
name: Real College Essays

text: especially after an exceptionally hard eight days in water-logged trenches. Our total casualties
name: Real College Essays

text: in the Vimy sector amounted to 17 killed or died of wounds, 69 wounded and five missing.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was a matter of great regret to us to hear later that the 25th Division suffered very heavily
name: Real College Essays

text: shortly after we left, when the enemy made a determined attack on the front recently held by
name: Real College Essays

text: us, and recaptured several trenches.
name: Real College Essays

text: At the time of our relief in the Vimy sector, plans at General Headquarters must have been
name: Real College Essays

text: in a forward state for the great offensive, which was to take place later in the year, and
name: Real College Essays

text: the part which the 46th Division was to play in that offensive must also have been fixed, and
name: Real College Essays

text: all our preparations now were for operations on a large scale.
name: Real College Essays

text: We soon got rid of the mud and filth of the trenches, and were fortunate in finding at Tincques
name: Real College Essays

text: excellent baths run by the 51st Division, of which we made the best possible use, and having
name: Real College Essays

text: got our clothes and boots into respectable order, and everyone generally tidied up, it was
name: Real College Essays

text: not long before we were in very good form and fit for anything. Whilst this and other work
name: Real College Essays

text: connected with the interior economy of the Battalion was going on, some of the Officers had
name: Real College Essays

text: to spend a rather long day on Easter Monday, April 24th, in making a reconnaissance of the
name: Real College Essays

text: Corps line between Maroeuil and Mont St. Eloy.
name: Real College Essays

text: On April 26th, we were inspected by General Shipley, and felt rather pleased with the result
name: Real College Essays

text: of our efforts at cleaning, for the Battalion looked well, and the General expressed his pleasure
name: Real College Essays

text: at the smart turnout.
name: Real College Essays

text: The weather now was improving fast, and though excellent for training, it seemed too lovely
name: Real College Essays

text: on some of those delightful Spring days, to be spending our time learning how to kill people.
name: Real College Essays

text: Training included the new form of bayonet fighting, expounded by Officers and others on their
name: Real College Essays

text: return from the Third Army School, where they had been duly instructed in its art by that expert,
name: Real College Essays

text: Major Campbell, who always succeeded in his inimitable way in so impressing his hearers, that
name: Real College Essays

text: they were not likely to forget for many a long day that "two inches well placed" was ample,
name: Real College Essays

text: and many other similar maxims. Many tips were also given us in bayonet fighting by Sergt.-Major
name: Real College Essays

text: Curly, one of the travelling Physical Training Instructors, who often came to see us, and made
name: Real College Essays

text: a great impression on all who ever came under his instruction by his extraordinary keenness
name: Real College Essays

text: and energy. Eventually we passed on to practise the attack in "waves," and were initiated into
name: Real College Essays

text: the art of doing this under the shelter of a smoke screen. In this form of attack, the advance
name: Real College Essays

text: from the moment of leaving the trenches, was carried out behind a smoke barrage, formed by
name: Real College Essays

text: lighting smoke bombs in the front line trench, and heaving them forward over the parapet. If
name: Real College Essays

text: they were good, a dense cloud of smoke was produced, and, provided the wind was in the right
name: Real College Essays

text: direction, it was possible to advance concealed behind the smoke cloud for a considerable distance.
name: Real College Essays
