text: This method depended almost entirely for its success on the strength and direction of the wind.
name: Real College Essays

text: Later on, when the method was improved in the light of experience gained, smoke grenades fired
name: Real College Essays

text: from rifles were used, together with smoke shells fired by the artillery, so that a barrage
name: Real College Essays

text: could be put down at any required point, and, except in very strong winds, the smoke made to
name: Real College Essays

text: drift across any desired portion of the front of attack. In many of the later attacks this
name: Real College Essays

text: was done extensively, and was on the whole very successful. We practised at Tincques with hand
name: Real College Essays

text: smoke bombs only, and found it was not very difficult to keep direction through the smoke,
name: Real College Essays

text: whilst at the same time we were screened from the vision of the enemy.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our period of training at this juncture was not a long one, as we were required nearer the
name: Real College Essays

text: front to begin the many operations necessary to prepare for the big attack. During that short
name: Real College Essays

text: period, however, we had to change our billets, and moved on April 29th, to Averdoignt, a pretty
name: Real College Essays

text: little village near St. Pol, where we were well housed and very comfortable. From there we
name: Real College Essays

text: were called upon to send a detachment for a few weeks' duty at Third Army Headquarters, at
name: Real College Essays

text: St. Pol, and a composite company consisting of 60 of B Company, and 100 of C under Major G.
name: Real College Essays

text: S. Heathcote were entrusted with the task. They must have done excellent work and evidently
name: Real College Essays

text: made a good impression, as a letter of special praise on their smartness and good work, was
name: Real College Essays

text: sent to the Battalion, on their return by the Army Commander, General Allenby.
name: Real College Essays

text: We moved by easy steps from this area, which we left on May 6th, marching that day to Rebreuviette,
name: Real College Essays

text: the following day to Gaudiempr??, and on the 10th to Bienvillers. The Transport remained behind
name: Real College Essays

text: at Gaudiempr??, but moved from there on the 11th to La Baz??que Farm, near Humbercamps. This
name: Real College Essays

text: move brought us into the VII Corps, commanded by Lieut.-General T. D'O. Snow.
name: Real College Essays

text: Up to the time of our arrival this part of the line was reputed to be almost the quietest on
name: Real College Essays

text: the whole of the Western Front. It was said that Company Commanders slept in pyjamas, even
name: Real College Essays

text: when holding the front line, and certainly the personnel of Battalion Headquarters at Foncquevillers,
name: Real College Essays

text: which was only about 1000 yards from the enemy line, lived there for all the world, as if in
name: Real College Essays

text: a peaceful country village in England. The dug-outs were made for comfort rather than safety,
name: Real College Essays

text: and were in many cases artistically decorated with pictures, doubtless got from houses in the
name: Real College Essays

text: village, and surrounded with elegant little garden plots, which showed evident signs of careful
name: Real College Essays

text: tending on the part of our predecessors. Together they formed a kind of miniature "Garden City."
name: Real College Essays

text: This comparative quietness lasted for a considerable time after our arrival; indeed we often
name: Real College Essays

text: failed to understand why the enemy refrained from shelling, as on many occasions we must have
name: Real College Essays

text: offered exceptionally favourable targets. Day by day work went on often in full view of the
name: Real College Essays

text: Hun, and within a range of between one and two miles, and the roads almost daily were a mass
name: Real College Essays

text: of transport of every kind, moving to and fro in broad daylight, and literally asking for trouble.
name: Real College Essays

text: There can be no question that the chief reason was a great shortage of ammunition at this time
name: Real College Essays

text: amongst the Germans, who were under very strict orders as to its conservation, otherwise no
name: Real College Essays

text: doubt we should have had a very disagreeable time. Doubtless they made careful note of all
name: Real College Essays

text: our doings, and the fact that something big was going to take place must have been perfectly
name: Real College Essays

text: obvious to them. That it was so we found afterwards, when in a successful attack, the diary
name: Real College Essays

text: of the German regiment opposite to us (55th R.I.R.) was captured, and from it we learned that
name: Real College Essays

text: they had been able to foresee exactly where the attack was coming. This diary was most interesting
name: Real College Essays

text: reading, as it noted each day their observations of our doings, and the conclusions they drew
name: Real College Essays

text: from them.
name: Real College Essays

text: The attack of the 46th Division was to be directed against the German trenches West of Gommecourt,
name: Real College Essays

text: immediately opposite the village of Foncquevillers. The German trench line here, forming the
name: Real College Essays

text: Gommecourt salient, was the most Westerly point that they ever held as a permanent line. The
name: Real College Essays

text: general object of the attack was to cut off this salient. The 56th Division were to attack
name: Real College Essays

text: on the South, and join hands with our Division East of the village of Gommecourt, and so establish
name: Real College Essays

text: the left flank of the whole Somme attack.
name: Real College Essays

text: All the efforts of the troops of our Division who were not actually holding the line, were
name: Real College Essays

text: concentrated on preparing the Divisional front for the attack. The chief work that we were
name: Real College Essays

text: concerned with, was the digging out of old communication trenches from Foncquevillers to the
name: Real College Essays

text: front line, a distance of about 700 yards. There were something like ten or a dozen of these,
name: Real College Essays

text: several of which were named after our Division. The principal were "Stafford Avenue," "Lincoln
name: Real College Essays

text: Lane," "Leicester Street," "Nottingham Street," "Derby Dyke," "Roberts Avenue," "Rotten Row,"
name: Real College Essays

text: Regent Street, "Raymond Avenue," and "Crawlboys Lane." All these had to be dug out about
name: Real College Essays

text: two feet below their existing level, making them about seven feet deep, and boarded with trench
name: Real College Essays

text: grids from end to end, which entailed an enormous amount of work. In addition, the front line
name: Real College Essays

text: had to be cleared of the barbed wire, with which the unoccupied portions had been filled, support
name: Real College Essays

text: and reserve trenches had to be prepared for the supporting troops in the attack, forward or
name: Real College Essays

text: jumping-off trenches to be dug at the last moment, for the assaulting troops to attack from,
name: Real College Essays

text: Russian saps to be dug out into No Man's Land to form communication trenches, by knocking
name: Real College Essays

text: in the thin covering of earth left to hide them, dug-outs to be made for forward Battalion
name: Real College Essays

text: Headquarters, and several miles of narrow cable trench to be dug about six feet deep for the
name: Real College Essays

text: protection of telephone wires from forward Headquarters back to Brigade, Division and Artillery
name: Real College Essays

text: Headquarters. In addition to all this navvying work, large quantities of stores had to be carried
name: Real College Essays

text: up to forward dumps in the trenches, ready for taking forward if the attack succeeded, shelters
name: Real College Essays

text: had to be made at various points in side trenches, convenient to get at from communication
name: Real College Essays

text: trenches, for storing large quantities of bombs of all kinds, small arm ammunition, iron rations,
name: Real College Essays

text: water, picks, shovels, sandbags, and other Royal Engineers' material likely to be required
name: Real College Essays

text: to consolidate the ground we hoped to win in the attack. The transport of all these stores,
name: Real College Essays

text: and of all the necessary Royal Engineers' material, and the work entailed in all these preparations
name: Real College Essays

text: was colossal, and our first real experience of anything of the kind. It is probable that at
name: Real College Essays

text: this time the mass and variety of material required in an attack, reached a degree of complication
name: Real College Essays

text: never equalled either before or after. The German comment on this contained in the diary already
name: Real College Essays

text: mentioned is of interest. "It must be acknowledged," it states, "that the equipment and preparation
name: Real College Essays

text: of the English attack were magnificent. The assaulting troops were amply provided with numerous
name: Real College Essays

text: machine guns, Lewis guns, trench mortars, and storming-ladders. The Officers were provided
name: Real College Essays

text: with excellent maps, which shewed every German trench system actually named and gave every
name: Real College Essays

text: detail of our positions. The sketches had been brought up to date with all our latest work,
name: Real College Essays

text: and the sectors of attack were shewn on a very large scale. Special sketches shewing the objectives
name: Real College Essays

text: of the different units, also aeroplane photographs were found amongst the captured documents."
name: Real College Essays

text: During our week at Bienvillers from May 10th to 18th, we were mostly engaged in improving the
name: Real College Essays

text: defences of the village, and the approach trenches behind Foncquevillers, and in work on cable
name: Real College Essays

text: trenches. It was here that one or two civilians roused our suspicions, as they insisted on
name: Real College Essays

text: ploughing and carrying on their cultivations so very near the front, some days working with
name: Real College Essays

text: grey horses, others with brown, and our Battalion Scouts were told to keep a special eye on
name: Real College Essays

text: them. Nothing, however, happened so far as we were aware that in any way altered the course
name: Real College Essays

text: of the war, as a result of our or their action.
name: Real College Essays

text: On May 19th, we relieved the 5th North Staffords in Foncquevillers, being then in reserve to
name: Real College Essays

text: our 5th, 6th, and 7th Battalions, who were holding the front line. Our Transport moved the
name: Real College Essays

text: following day to Souastre.
name: Real College Essays

text: This was a somewhat uneventful period, and after a few days in the front line mostly spent
name: Real College Essays

text: in improving trenches, we were relieved on June 5th, by the 4th Leicesters, and marched back
name: Real College Essays

text: to huts at Humbercamp, preparatory to moving further back for our final training for the "Big
name: Real College Essays

text: Push." We left there the following night, and arrived in the early hours of June 7th at Le
name: Real College Essays

text: Souich, where we were destined to spend one of the least enjoyable periods out of the line
name: Real College Essays

text: that we ever experienced. We were only there for a week, but into that short time was crammed
name: Real College Essays

text: an immense amount of work both in training, and in cutting wood and making wattle hurdles in
name: Real College Essays

text: Lucheux Forest. The weather was very wet, and our billets were anything but comfortable. In
name: Real College Essays

text: our humble opinion the training here was too strenuous. We had to march out four miles to the
name: Real College Essays

text: training ground, and four miles back in full marching order, practise the attack for two hours
name: Real College Essays

text: through fields of growing corn three or four feet high soaked with rain, and complete six hours
name: Real College Essays

text: training daily (not including the marching) with bayonet fighting, physical exercises, and
name: Real College Essays

text: drill in the fields near our billets. It takes very little of such intensive training to make
name: Real College Essays

text: men stale.
name: Real College Essays

text: The form of attack practised was that ordered for the general attack, which we now knew was
name: Real College Essays

text: to take place about the end of June: this allowed each Battalion a frontage of 250 yards, with
name: Real College Essays

text: three Companies in front, and one in support, each Company having its four platoons echelonned
name: Real College Essays

text: in depth at distances of about 50 yards, thus forming four "waves," the men in each wave being
name: Real College Essays

text: extended to about four paces. In the attack the leading wave was to go through to the final
name: Real College Essays

text: objective, the other waves occupying and mopping up the trenches passed over by the leading wave.
name: Real College Essays

text: A full size model of the German lines at Gommecourt that we were to attack, was made near Sus-St.
name: Real College Essays

text: Leger, the trenches being dug to a depth of about two feet. Tape lines were laid for the men
name: Real College Essays

text: to form up on, and the whole attack was practised time and again as a "drill," until eventually
name: Real College Essays

text: we were able to carry it out without losing direction, with a fair amount of success.
name: Real College Essays

text: We were now stronger in Officers than we had ever been during the campaign, our strength being
name: Real College Essays

text: 38. This was due to the recent arrival of several reinforcements, including Capt. Piggford
name: Real College Essays

text: and Lieut. Hindley, rejoined, and 2nd Lieuts. H. de C. Martelli, J. B. White, C. J. Wells,
name: Real College Essays

text: A. G. T. Lomer, T. G. Day, E. A. Huskinson, H. I. Newton, and A. A. Field. We had, however,
name: Real College Essays

text: lost Capt. Lawson, who left for a tour of duty at home, and Major E. H. Heathcote, Capt. Gray,
name: Real College Essays

text: and 2nd Lieut. Hodgson invalided to England, also 2nd Lieut. Peerless, who unfortunately got
name: Real College Essays

text: badly hurt one day by accidentally kicking a live rifle grenade, which had been left lying
name: Real College Essays

text: on the bombing practice ground. His place as Battalion Grenade Officer was taken by 2nd Lieut.
name: Real College Essays

text: Duff. Lieut. Simonet had gone to hospital, and was succeeded as Lewis Gun Officer by 2nd Lieut.
name: Real College Essays

text: Tomlinson. Major G. S. Heathcote was attached to Headquarters, Third Army, and was succeeded
name: Real College Essays

text: in command of C Company by Capt. Piggford, whilst Major Ashwell became Second-in-Command. We
name: Real College Essays

text: were not particularly strong in other ranks, something less than 500 being available for the
name: Real College Essays

text: attack, though we had recently received over 100 reinforcements, including a very good draft
name: Real College Essays

text: of 61 from the 2nd Sherwood Foresters. Fortunately General Headquarters had taken an excellent
name: Real College Essays

text: step in laying down that certain Officers and other ranks known as "Battle Details," were now
name: Real College Essays

text: to be left out of every attack to form a nucleus for carrying on Battalions in the event of
name: Real College Essays

text: their suffering heavy casualties. This was a very wise precaution, and was adopted by us for
name: Real College Essays

text: the first time in the attack at Gommecourt.
name: Real College Essays

text: On June 15th, we marched to Humbercamp, the Transport at the same time moving to lines at La
name: Real College Essays

text: Baz??que Farm. Capt. H. Kirby was now Transport Officer, having taken over from Capt. Davenport,
name: Real College Essays

text: who, after being attached for some time to XVII Corps Light Railway Company, Royal Engineers,
name: Real College Essays

text: went to Brigade Headquarters to learn Staff work. The transport vehicles had somewhat camouflaged
name: Real College Essays

text: themselves, having been decorated on all sides by wonderful and mystic signs, so as to show
name: Real College Essays

text: to the initiated to what unit they belonged. If you enquired you would be told that the dark
name: Real College Essays

text: blue square meant "First Line Transport," the narrow light green oblong edged with white placed
name: Real College Essays

text: on the left of this square was for the "8th Sherwood Foresters," whilst the square divided
name: Real College Essays

text: diagonally into red and green, and bordered with white, was the sign of the "46th Division."
name: Real College Essays

text: It was not an easy matter to arrange all these coloured patches clear of the odds and ends
name: Real College Essays

text: carried on the different vehicles, and this problem was still exercising the minds of those
name: Real College Essays

text: in authority nearly up to the Armistice--such an important part did it play in the ultimate
name: Real College Essays

text: winning of the war!
name: Real College Essays

text: We now knew that in our Brigade we were to be the Battalion in reserve, the 5th and 7th Battalions
name: Real College Essays

text: having to carry out the assault, with the 6th Battalion in immediate support. As a consequence
name: Real College Essays

text: much of the "dirty" work during the final preparations for the attack fell to our lot. This
name: Real College Essays

text: consisted chiefly in holding the trenches during our preliminary bombardment, and putting up
name: Real College Essays

text: with such retaliation as the Hun might choose to carry out, and in completing the final arrangements
name: Real College Essays

text: in our own trenches. After three days at Humbercamp, during which we found large working parties
name: Real College Essays

text: for digging cable trenches, and putting up screens to conceal the approaches to trenches, we
name: Real College Essays

text: moved to Foncquevillers on June 18th, and took over part of the left sub-sector from the 5th
name: Real College Essays

text: Lincolns. An immense amount of work had been done whilst we had been away; the prospects seemed
name: Real College Essays

text: bright, and our hopes rose. Our Headquarters at Foncquevillers became a centre of attraction
name: Real College Essays

text: to all and sundry. At every hour of the day and night we had callers, from the Divisional Commander
name: Real College Essays

text: downwards. The Brigadier and his staff constantly paid us visits. Gunners galore came to sample
name: Real College Essays

text: what we kept, and incidentally to see about finding observation posts. Royal Engineer gentlemen
name: Real College Essays

text: requested our help at every turn and corner, usually wanting working parties rather larger
name: Real College Essays

text: than our total strength, whilst "Tock Emma" Officers were on our doorstep day and night. Indeed
name: Real College Essays

text: so great was the crowd that at one time we almost had to put Corpl. Cross on to regulate the
name: Real College Essays

text: queue, and all the time our poor stock of victuals and drinks was getting less and less.
name: Real College Essays

text: All went well until the afternoon of June 23rd, when there was a violent thunderstorm, which
name: Real College Essays

text: practically undid the whole of the work we had carried out in the trenches, filling them in
name: Real College Essays

text: most cases to a depth of two feet or more with mud and water. This area was a difficult one
name: Real College Essays

text: to drain, and it was impossible to get the water away, so that all hands had to be got on as
name: Real College Essays

text: soon as possible to man trench pumps, and endeavour to clear the trenches in that way. This
name: Real College Essays

text: method was extremely laborious, and very little real progress was made, though every available
name: Real College Essays

text: man was put on to the work. Our poor dug-outs were knee deep in water, and the newly constructed
name: Real College Essays

text: bomb and other stores were too weak to stand such a storm, and in most cases collapsed. Our
name: Real College Essays

text: hopes sank, for we realised how much depended on all the careful preparations which had been
name: Real College Essays

text: made, and that the time left before the attack would be all too short for us to get the damage
name: Real College Essays

text: repaired.
name: Real College Essays

text: It is impossible to give anything like an adequate idea of our plight for the next few days.
name: Real College Essays

text: The artillery scheme, including a six days' bombardment, began on the following day with wire
name: Real College Essays

text: cutting, causing a certain amount of retaliation, which added to our trouble. This got worse
name: Real College Essays

text: on the following days, doubtless owing partly to the fact that we dug a new advanced trench.
name: Real College Essays

text: This was in a deplorable mess, and our men who had to occupy it had a most distressing time.
name: Real College Essays

text: Casualties rose rapidly, especially in B Company, whose front line trench was enfiladed from
name: Real College Essays

text: Adinfer Wood. Our carrying parties, who had to take up Royal Engineer material, ammunition
name: Real College Essays

text: of all sorts, rations and other stores to various points in the line, mostly adopted the very
name: Real College Essays

text: suitable dress of a sandbag kilt and boots. They were objects of much interest, but it was
name: Real College Essays

text: the most workmanlike rig-out for our trenches, which in many cases remained knee deep in mud
name: Real College Essays

text: and water for several days. The carrying had to go on whatever happened, and continued night
name: Real College Essays

text: and day, assistance being got from the 6th and 7th Battalions, from the Machine Gun Company,
name: Real College Essays

text: and from the Transport men of all units, parties of whom marched up nightly for the purpose.
name: Real College Essays

text: With trenches in such a state, it is needless to say that it was impossible for men to hold
name: Real College Essays

text: the line for many days, and in order to give us a brief respite, we were relieved by the 5th
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion on the night of June 27th, and moved back to Pommier.
name: Real College Essays

text: The nine strenuous days during which we had held the line, had been a severe trial, and where
name: Real College Essays

text: everyone did so well it is difficult to single out any for special mention, but we feel we
name: Real College Essays

text: must say how much we owed to Capts. Turner, Vann and Hill, for the excellent way in which they
name: Real College Essays

text: worked to keep up the spirits of their men during those trying times, and to Sergts. Slater
name: Real College Essays

text: and Rawding, for the splendid way they kept their men together during several particularly
name: Real College Essays

text: unpleasant "straffs" by the Boche of our front trenches. During that time, too, much excellent
name: Real College Essays

text: patrolling was done by Marshall, who unfortunately was wounded one day when taking rather too
name: Real College Essays

text: great risks in observing the Boche lines, and Martelli, ably helped by L.-Corpl. Hickman, and
name: Real College Essays

text: Pvte. E. C. Bryan. Our casualties during those nine days included Capt. Vann, slightly wounded,
name: Real College Essays

text: Lieut. Hindley, who got a nasty splinter wound on the nose, 16 other ranks killed, and 44 wounded.
name: Real College Essays

text: The chief incident during our two days' stay at Pommier, occurred on the afternoon of June
name: Real College Essays

text: 30th, when the Huns began shelling the church. John Turner, Michie and Harvey, were having
name: Real College Essays

text: tea in their mess, which was only a few yards from the church, when a 5.9 blew in the end of
name: Real College Essays

text: the house, practically bursting inside the room where they were sitting. Their escape was little
name: Real College Essays

text: short of a miracle. John Turner, however, as one would expect, came into Headquarters smiling
name: Real College Essays

text: and perfectly cool, though covered with dust and blood. Harvey and Michie were a bit shaken,
name: Real College Essays

text: the former having to go to hospital.
name: Real College Essays

text: The attack, having been postponed owing to the bad weather, was eventually fixed to take place
name: Real College Essays

text: on the morning of July 1st, and we left Pommier again the night before to take up our position
name: Real College Essays

text: at Foncquevillers. Our cookers were taken down to the Western edge of the wood behind the village,
name: Real College Essays

text: where we were issued with soup and rum on arrival at about 10 p.m. Each man carried in addition
name: Real College Essays

text: to the following day's ration, his iron ration, and a bacon and bread sandwich. Equipment carried
name: Real College Essays

text: included 200 rounds small arm ammunition, four sandbags, two Mills grenades, two gas helmets,
name: Real College Essays

text: haversack, waterproof sheet, and a supply of wire cutters and gloves. The new pattern "tin
name: Real College Essays

text: hat," with which we had by this time all been supplied, formed a by no means unimportant part
name: Real College Essays

text: of our dress. It was not a thing of beauty, and took a little while to get used to, but it
name: Real College Essays

text: proved a good friend to many in the days that were to come.
name: Real College Essays

text: The attack by the 46th Division was to be carried out with two Brigades, Staffords and Sherwood
name: Real College Essays

text: Foresters, with the Lincolns and Leicesters in reserve. The 139th Brigade on the left was to
name: Real College Essays

text: attack between the Northern edge of Gommecourt Wood and the "Little Z," the 5th Battalion being
name: Real College Essays

text: on the right, and 7th on the left, the 6th Battalion in support, and 8th in Reserve; the German
name: Real College Essays

text: first, second and third lines were to be captured, and in conjunction with the 56th Division
name: Real College Essays

text: on the right, our line was to be carried to a point just East of Gommecourt village.
name: Real College Essays

text: We reached our assembly positions early on the morning of July 1st. Our bombardment opened
name: Real College Essays

text: at 6.25 a.m. and the discharge of smoke from our front line began an hour later. Under cover
name: Real College Essays

text: of this the assaulting Battalions moved off from our advanced trenches at 7.30 a.m. A heavy
name: Real College Essays

text: and accurate barrage was immediately put down on our front and support lines by the enemy,
name: Real College Essays

text: who were evidently well aware of the extent of the attack and ready for it. The attack by the
name: Real College Essays

text: 139th Brigade is described in the following extracts from the captured diary of the 55th R.I.R.,
name: Real College Essays

text: the times given being German:--
name: Real College Essays

text: "G1. sector 7.30 a.m. An extremely violent bombardment began,
name: Real College Essays

text: overwhelming all the trenches and sweeping away the wire.
name: Real College Essays

text: 8.30 a.m. The enemy's fire lifted. The enemy's attack, which was
name: Real College Essays

text: made under cover of gas bombs, was perceived. In consequence of
name: Real College Essays

text: the sharp look-out kept by the Commander of the 4th Company, and
name: Real College Essays

text: by a Platoon Commander holding the most dangerous portion of the
name: Real College Essays

text: line, the shell holes were occupied exactly at the right moment,
name: Real College Essays

text: and the attackers were received with hand grenades. The barrage
name: Real College Essays

text: fire which had been called for began at once.
name: Real College Essays

text: 8.40 a.m. Strong hostile skirmishing lines deployed from Pilier
name: Real College Essays

text: Farm. They were at once met by heavy machine gun and infantry
name: Real College Essays

text: fire. Second Lieut. ----, of the 2nd Company who was holding the
name: Real College Essays

text: 3rd support line of G1, recognised the superior strength of the
name: Real College Essays

text: enemy's attack which was being carried out against No. 4 Company.
name: Real College Essays

text: In spite of the intense bombardment he decided to advance with
name: Real College Essays

text: his Platoon over the open, and, crossing the second line, reached
name: Real College Essays

text: the front line of G1 at the decisive moment to reinforce No. 4
name: Real College Essays

text: Company.
name: Real College Essays

text: The enemy built up his firing line and attempted to press forward
name: Real College Essays

text: with bombers and flame-projectors, but was repulsed everywhere.
name: Real College Essays

text: 10.30 a.m. The fine spirit of the troops of the 2nd and 4th
name: Real College Essays

text: Companies succeeded by their stubborn resistance in annihilating
name: Real College Essays

text: the thick charging waves of the English. The ground was covered
name: Real College Essays

text: with numbers of dead, and in front of our trench lay quantities
name: Real College Essays

text: of English arms and equipment. Gradually the artillery fire
name: Real College Essays

text: recommenced on the front line trenches and rose to a pitch of
name: Real College Essays

text: extreme violence in the course of the afternoon. The fact that
name: Real College Essays

text: all attacks were completely repulsed without the enemy gaining a
name: Real College Essays

text: footing in the front line of G1. at any point is due, next to the
name: Real College Essays

text: bravery of the troops, to the carefully thought-out arrangements
name: Real College Essays

text: of Major ----, to the care of the Officer Commanding No. 4
name: Real College Essays

text: Company, and to the energy of the Platoon Commanders."
name: Real College Essays

text: To resume our own story. At about 8.0 a.m., as the forward trenches were cleared of troops,
name: Real College Essays

text: we began to move forward, but everywhere found the trenches, which were still in many parts
name: Real College Essays

text: deep in mud and water, blown in, or blocked by dead bodies, or wounded men trying to make their
name: Real College Essays

text: way back. Little progress was possible, and there was nothing to be done but to await further
name: Real College Essays

text: developments.
name: Real College Essays

text: Although little news came through, it soon became evident that the attack on our front had
name: Real College Essays

text: not succeeded. We learnt later that, owing to the difficulty experienced by the supporting
name: Real College Essays

text: waves in getting across our own water-logged trenches, they lost the advantage of the barrage,
name: Real College Essays

text: and that the smoke cleared long before the bulk of the assaulting troops had got across No
name: Real College Essays

text: Man's Land. In spite of our long protracted artillery bombardment comparatively little damage
name: Real College Essays

text: had been done to the German trenches and wire, and our men met with heavy rifle and machine
name: Real College Essays

text: gun fire, not only from their front, but also from the right flank, where the 137th Brigade
name: Real College Essays

text: were unable to gain the German front line owing to uncut wire. A few of both the 5th and 7th
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalions got into the German trenches, but they were soon surrounded and overwhelmed. Some
name: Real College Essays

text: who were wounded before reaching the wire, crawled for shelter into shell holes, where in several
name: Real College Essays

text: instances, they were deliberately bombed or shot by the Boche from their trenches. At 3 p.m.
name: Real College Essays

text: a fresh bombardment was begun by the right Brigade, and continued on our front, with a view
name: Real College Essays

text: to an attack being made by two Companies of the 6th Battalion, but this was cancelled.
name: Real College Essays

text: At 5.5 p.m. we were ordered to send out daylight patrols to ascertain the position of affairs
name: Real College Essays

text: in front. Several volunteers, amongst whom were Corpls. G. Clay, and C. E. Bryan, L.-Corpls.
name: Real College Essays

text: Moss and Hickman, and Pvtes. Charles, Brett, Adams, and Nightingall, remained out for some
name: Real College Essays

text: time, and brought back useful information. Meanwhile much gallant work was also being done
name: Real College Essays

text: by the Stretcher Bearers and others. Pvtes. Holbery, Thomas, Nelson, and Shearman worked continuously
name: Real College Essays

text: for nearly 36 hours carrying in wounded, often under heavy fire, whilst Comp. Sergt.-Major
name: Real College Essays

text: T. Powell, who brought in three wounded men by daylight, and Sergt. Grainger, who controlled
name: Real College Essays

text: his men with great skill during the battle and also rescued a wounded man, are deserving of
name: Real College Essays

text: special mention.
name: Real College Essays

text: At 6.10 p.m. we received instructions to take over the original front and advanced trenches
name: Real College Essays

text: from the 6th, and remnants of the 5th and 7th Battalions, who were there, and this was done.
name: Real College Essays

text: Later, however, the 5th Lincolns took over the line as they had been ordered to carry out another
name: Real College Essays

text: attack at midnight, in order to try and rescue some of the 5th and 7th Battalions, who it was
name: Real College Essays

text: thought were still in the Boche trenches. This, however, was not pressed, and finally A Company
name: Real College Essays

text: of our Battalion were given the melancholy task of scouring No Man's Land to find the dead
name: Real College Essays

text: and wounded. Eventually the 5th Lincolns took over from us on the morning of the 2nd July,
name: Real College Essays

text: and we withdrew the same day to billets at Gaudiempr??.
name: Real College Essays

text: Even as we left Foncquevillers ill-luck pursued us, for a premature burst of a shell from one
name: Real College Essays

text: of our guns took place close to us as we were formed up behind the wood ready to move off,
name: Real College Essays

text: and wounded four, fortunately not seriously. Otherwise our casualties during the actual battle
name: Real College Essays

text: had not been heavy, amounting to three killed, two missing (attached to Trench Mortar Battery)
name: Real College Essays

text: and 37 wounded.
name: Real College Essays

text: We cannot look back with anything but regret on that awful battle, when so many lives were
name: Real College Essays

text: sacrificed apparently to no purpose. July 1st is not our happiest of days--indeed on two successive
name: Real College Essays

text: occasions it was our most unfortunate day of the year. It must have been quite obvious to the
name: Real College Essays

text: enemy that this was to be the flank of the Somme attack, although some demonstration was made
name: Real College Essays

text: by the 37th Division on our left. The enemy, therefore, were able to bring all their guns from
name: Real College Essays

text: the direction of Adinfer Wood to bear on No Man's Land on our front. Lack of troops had necessitated
name: Real College Essays

text: the employment of the attacking Battalions in the most exacting fatigues up to the very eve
name: Real College Essays

text: of the assault. Probably, barely a man had had a full night's sleep for a week prior to the
name: Real College Essays

text: attack, and there had been scarcely a day or night when rain had not fallen consistently and
name: Real College Essays

text: heavily, and working parties had not been soaked through to the skin. Those of us, who eight
name: Real College Essays

text: months later, stood on some of the German concrete machine gun emplacements opposite, commanding
name: Real College Essays

text: a magnificent field of fire from positions proof against the heaviest shells, saw still the
name: Real College Essays

text: lines of dead bodies lying in No Man's Land, a tragic and pitiable witness, if witness were
name: Real College Essays

text: needed, that the failure of the attack was in no measure due to any lack of dash or courage
name: Real College Essays

text: on the part of our indomitable Infantry. Practically every Officer of the attacking Battalions
name: Real College Essays

text: was killed or wounded, and a large proportion of the men, and but an insignificant proportion
name: Real College Essays

text: fell alive into the hands of the enemy.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was some slight comfort to receive from the Corps Commander an appreciation of our efforts,
name: Real College Essays

text: which had kept busy a large number of the enemy's best troops, and to know that we had a share
name: Real College Essays

text: in the success of the great Somme attack, and that our terrible losses were not entirely in vain.
name: Real College Essays

text: We spent one night at Gaudiempr??, and on July 3rd, moved a few miles North to a delightful
name: Real College Essays

text: Camp at Bavincourt, where we made up our minds to have a well-earned rest. The Camp was charmingly
name: Real College Essays

text: situated, and we were preparing to have it run on model lines, when alas, in the early hours
name: Real College Essays

text: of July 4th, sudden orders were received to move. We had, however, made the best of our few
name: Real College Essays

text: hours there, most of us going to an excellent entertainment by the "Barn Owls," the Concert
name: Real College Essays

text: Party of the 37th Division, which cheered us immensely.
name: Real College Essays

text: The fighting on the Somme, which had gone successfully for us in many parts, was causing rapid
name: Real College Essays

text: reorganisation and consequent movement of troops, so that our sudden move was not altogether
name: Real College Essays

text: surprising. We left Bavincourt on the morning of July 4th, and after a little excitement due
name: Real College Essays

text: to the shelling of the road, and a terrific thunderstorm, we eventually got settled once more
name: Real College Essays

text: at Pommier, with the exception of A Company, who went on to Bienvillers. The rest of the Battalion
name: Real College Essays

text: joined them there on July 7th, except Transport and Quarter-Master's Stores, which moved to
name: Real College Essays

text: La Cauchie. Our most important work there was the somewhat ticklish procedure on two nights
name: Real College Essays

text: of carrying up to the Monchy trenches, about two miles North of Foncquevillers, cylinders of
name: Real College Essays

text: gas to loose off on a suitable occasion. These were drawn at Hannescamp, and for carrying were
name: Real College Essays

text: fastened to poles, each cylinder requiring two men. Special precautions were taken to ensure
name: Real College Essays

text: perfect silence, so as not to give the enemy an idea that gas was being installed. Further,
name: Real College Essays

text: in order to protect the carrying party, in case any of the cylinders got broken by shells or
name: Real College Essays

text: otherwise on the way up, every man wore his smoke helmet rolled up on his head, ready for instantly
name: Real College Essays

text: pulling down over his face. Neither steel helmets nor caps were worn on these occasions. As
name: Real College Essays

text: the cylinders had to be got up to our front line trench, the operation was attended with considerable
name: Real College Essays

text: risk, but fortune favoured us, and it is believed that the Battalion never suffered a casualty
name: Real College Essays

text: when engaged on the work, though large parties had to be found on several occasions for a similar
name: Real College Essays

text: purpose.
name: Real College Essays

text: We moved on July 10th, by route march to Bellacourt, a village about five miles south-west
name: Real College Essays

text: of Arras, and giving its name to a sector which was to prove easily the most peaceful and enjoyable
name: Real College Essays

text: part of the line we ever held. Transport moved to Bailleulval, where they got good lines in
name: Real College Essays

text: a small orchard, and the Quarter-Master's Stores were comfortably fixed up in billets.
name: Real College Essays

text: It was from this department that we were first to hear of the activities of our new Divisional
name: Real College Essays

text: Commander, Major-General W. Thwaites, R.A., who made it a practice of frequently visiting transport
name: Real College Essays

text: lines at early morning stables. Torrance with his ready wit at once dubbed him "The Mushroom
name: Real College Essays

text: Picker," an epithet which we were told gave him much pleasure when it reached his ears, but
name: Real College Essays

text: did not have the least effect upon his early morning visits.
name: Real College Essays

text: Several new Officers had recently joined from our 3rd Line, including 2nd Lieuts. C. F. Woodward,
name: Real College Essays

text: F. M. Corry, H. G. Kirby, B. P. Page, W. B. Easterfield, and D. H. Parker. Second Lieut. A.
name: Real College Essays

text: Bedford also rejoined, and others who arrived shortly afterwards were Lieut. R. Whitton, who
name: Real College Essays

text: had been Adjutant of the 3rd Line, 2nd Lieuts. Skinner and Moore, back for the second time,
name: Real College Essays

text: and 2nd Lieuts. C. H. Hicks, D. F. Ranson, L. E. King-Stephens, G. F. Visser, F. D. Byrne,
name: Real College Essays

text: B. W. Hall, and A. D. Bailey. Comp. Sergt.-Major Haywood rejoined with a draft of 72 reinforcements,
name: Real College Essays

text: and was appointed Comp. Sergt.-Major of C Company, where Sergt. Leivers had been carrying on
name: Real College Essays

text: for a short time in place of Comp. Sergt.-Major J. A. Green, who had been invalided to England.
name: Real College Essays

text: We were thus fairly well off for numbers, when on July 11th, we relieved the Liverpool Scottish
name: Real College Essays

text: in the left sub-sector of the Brigade sector, this being one of the rare occasions on which
name: Real College Essays

text: relief was carried out by daylight. The distribution was as follows: Right--"The Willows"--A
name: Real College Essays

text: Company (Capt. Vann); Centre "The Osiers"--B Company (Capt. Turner); Left--"The Ravine"--C
name: Real College Essays

text: Company (Capt. Piggford); Reserve--Bretencourt--D Company (Capt. Hill). Battalion Headquarters
name: Real College Essays

text: was in the "Sunken Road," just in front of Bretencourt, off "Engineer Street." Each Company
name: Real College Essays

text: had two platoons in the front line and two in support; a system which, besides being more or
name: Real College Essays

text: less in accordance with Field Service Regulations, worked extremely satisfactorily, for whilst
name: Real College Essays

text: the front line posts could be held by comparatively few men, either in the line or at the heads
name: Real College Essays

text: of the various saps running out into No Man's Land, working parties and patrols were found
name: Real College Essays

text: from the support platoons, and were thus able to get back to the support line on completion
name: Real College Essays

text: of their task, and rest in comparative comfort.
name: Real College Essays

text: The frontage allotted to us was a long one, and the front line was thinly held, some of the
name: Real College Essays

text: posts being as much as 200 yards apart. Frequent visiting patrols were necessary during the
name: Real College Essays

text: night to prevent any daring Boche from getting into our lines. In the communication trenches,
name: Real College Essays

text: blocking posts and gates were fixed at various points to hold up the enemy if they did ever
name: Real College Essays

text: get in and attempt to push forward. To look after the rear portion of these communication trenches
name: Real College Essays

text: the system of Trench Wardens was instituted during our stay at Bellacourt. These were usually
name: Real College Essays

text: light duty, or warworn men drawn from the various Battalions, whose duty it was to repair broken
name: Real College Essays

text: trench grids, relay any that required it, clear falls of earth, and generally look after upkeep.
name: Real College Essays

text: This sector was reputed to be the quietest on the British Front, and though we had one or two
name: Real College Essays

text: lively times, there is no doubt that for the period of three-and-a-half months we were there,
name: Real College Essays

text: it lived up to its reputation. Rumour said that some of our troops had been in the habit of
name: Real College Essays

text: going out and repairing the barbed wire by daylight! Certainly it was normally extremely peaceful.
name: Real College Essays

text: The trenches were from 300 to 400 yards apart, and in the region of the Ransart Road on the
name: Real College Essays

text: right, one could indeed go out for some distance without coming in view of the Boche trenches.
name: Real College Essays

text: The weather during most of our stay was of the best, and there could be few things more pleasant
name: Real College Essays

text: than to stroll on a quiet afternoon round some of the communication trenches, e.g., "Dyke Street,"
name: Real College Essays

text: Couturelle, and "La Motte," where masses of wild flowers of every kind and of brilliant colours
name: Real College Essays

text: were in full bloom, and in many parts completely covered the sides of the trenches. Cooking
name: Real College Essays

text: was normally done out of the trenches, and hot meals were carried up in kettles or food containers
name: Real College Essays

text: (something in the nature of large thermos flasks) by the Reserve Company billeted at Bretencourt.
name: Real College Essays

text: We had something of a shock during our first tour in the trenches, and began to suspect the
name: Real College Essays

text: reports as to the quietness of the sector, for on our second morning the enemy poured over
name: Real College Essays

text: for nearly an hour, between 4.0 a.m. and 5.0 a.m., showers of heavy trench mortars on to part
name: Real College Essays

text: of the front line held by B Company. Their aim was very good, several bombs falling right into
name: Real College Essays

text: the trench and doing considerable damage, whilst Lieut. Lomer's Platoon, which was holding
name: Real College Essays

text: the part bombarded, had four men killed and nine wounded. One man had to have his foot amputated
name: Real College Essays

text: by Johnstone, the Medical Officer, in order to be released from a shelter that had been smashed
name: Real College Essays

text: by the bombs. Sergts. Tanner and Yeomans did splendid work in rescuing the wounded, as did
name: Real College Essays

text: also Sergt. Bescoby, Pvte. Axon and other Stretcher Bearers. This, however, turned out to be
name: Real College Essays

text: the only "hate" of its particular kind that the enemy inflicted on us during our stay. Possibly
name: Real College Essays

text: it was to let us know that he was aware of our recent arrival, and wished to give us a welcome,
name: Real College Essays

text: but most likely it was what we knew as his "Travelling Circus" which he brought up at certain
name: Real College Essays

text: times in order to carry out an organised "straff" on a particular piece of the line.
name: Real College Essays

text: For some time after this, and in fact for most of Our sojourn here, life in the trenches was
name: Real College Essays

text: of a somewhat humdrum character. There were a few days cf activity now and then, but normally
name: Real College Essays

text: the enemy was very inoffensive so far as we were concerned. He did, however, raid the 6th Battalion
name: Real College Essays

text: one night in the right sub-sector, almost completely levelling one of their communication trenches
name: Real College Essays

text: with heavy trench mortars during the preliminary bombardment, on account of which we had to
name: Real College Essays

text: stand-to, when back at our rest billets at Bailleulval. On another occasion we had a fidgety
name: Real College Essays

text: night owing to a gas alarm having been given. This however, proved but another case of "wind."
name: Real College Essays

text: The work in the trenches was of a normal character, but we welcomed that new article known
name: Real College Essays

text: as the "A" Frame, consisting as its name indicates of framing shaped like the letter A. This
name: Real College Essays

text: was the best form of support for trench revetment that we ever had, and from this time onwards
name: Real College Essays

text: was used almost universally. A suggestion of this exact form of framing had been made by Col.
name: Real College Essays

text: Blackwall as early as November 1915. and submitted to higher authorities, who turned it down
name: Real College Essays

text: as unsuitable.
name: Real College Essays

text: A further great advance was made by us here in the provision of deep dug-outs, for which the
name: Real College Essays

text: chalk soil was eminently adapted. Excellent plans were drawn out by Major Zeller, commanding
name: Real College Essays

text: the Field Company attached to our Brigade, for complete systems of these dug-outs to be made
name: Real College Essays

text: in the support line, and a special Brigade Dug-out Company was formed for this purpose, to
name: Real College Essays

text: which we contributed, besides a number of men, 2nd Lieuts. Moore and Powell. Great progress
name: Real College Essays

text: was made with the work, and before we left the sector a large number had been finished, and
name: Real College Essays

text: fitted up with wire beds on wooden framework in two tiers, with rifle racks and other etceteras.
name: Real College Essays

text: The organisation of this work was one of the first tasks of the new Brigade Major, Capt. W.
name: Real College Essays

text: P. Buckley, D.S.O., of the Duke of Cornwall's Light Infantry, who had succeeded Major Neilson,
name: Real College Essays

text: when the latter left to take up a higher appointment. In Major Neilson we lost one who was
name: Real College Essays

text: always ready to help and advise on every possible occasion, and though it was with the greatest
name: Real College Essays

text: regret that we said goodbye to him, it was a great pleasure to know that his hard work had
name: Real College Essays

text: brought its reward.
name: Real College Essays

text: At this period after doing six days in the front line, we spent six days in Brigade Reserve
name: Real College Essays

text: at Bellacourt, where three Companies were in billets, and usually found large parties for the
name: Real College Essays

text: Royal Engineers for working in trenches and dug-outs, and one Company provided garrisons for
name: Real College Essays

text: the four posts in front of the village, "Starfish," "Boundary," "Burnt Farm" and "Orchard."
name: Real College Essays

text: After a further six days in the front line we went back for six days to Bailleulval, where
name: Real College Essays

text: we were able to have our periodical clean up, do a little training, and generally enjoy life
name: Real College Essays

text: for a brief space. We relieved always with the 7th Battalion, and held the left of the Brigade
name: Real College Essays

text: sector, which remained the same as originally taken over, except that we gave up the "Willows"
name: Real College Essays

text: on the right and took over "Epsom" on the left.
name: Real College Essays

text: Our billets at Bailleulval were fairly comfortable, and were constantly improved, under the
name: Real College Essays

text: guiding hand of Major Wordsworth, the Staff Captain. We had a splendid parade ground on the
name: Real College Essays

text: high land behind the village, a good Canteen, a Sergeants' Mess, a Corporals' Mess, home-made
name: Real College Essays

text: Russian baths erected with much skill by our own Pioneers, and frequent visits from the "Whizz-bangs,"
name: Real College Essays

text: who gave us excellent programmes. We played cricket, football, both soccer and rugger; we had
name: Real College Essays

text: Officers' Riding Classes, which were a source of much interest not to say amusement, to the
name: Real College Essays

text: onlookers, and we got good dinners at the well-known "Seven Sisters," in the neighbouring village
name: Real College Essays

text: of Basseux. The weather for the most part was delightful, and life was extremely pleasant.
name: Real College Essays

text: Major-General Thwaites twice inspected us, and all who were in the Battalion during the time
name: Real College Essays

text: he reigned at Division will remember what an inspection by him entailed! Our best salute proved
name: Real College Essays

text: very inadequate on the first occasion, and the Commanding Officer was requested, after putting
name: Real College Essays

text: himself and his horse in front of the centre of the Battalion, to do it again! Capt. Turner,
name: Real College Essays

text: too, who was acting Second-in-Command, got a polite enquiry as to what he was doing with his
name: Real College Essays

text: horse! Poor "Strawberry" was apparently rather upset over the fixing of bayonets! As a rule,
name: Real College Essays

text: however, we believe our efforts to make a good show did not pass unnoticed, though a good deal
name: Real College Essays

text: that was uncomplimentary was said. On his second inspection Lieut.-General Snow, the Corps
name: Real College Essays

text: Commander, was with him, and appeared to be quite satisfied with the turnout.
name: Real College Essays

text: Training at this time, so far as the Battalion was concerned, consisted only of such general
name: Real College Essays

text: work as could be done in the few days we spent periodically at Bailleulval. The Divisional
name: Real College Essays

text: School, however, was in full going order, Regimental Sergt.-Major Mounteney doing duty there
name: Real College Essays

text: for a time, and in addition a Brigade School was formed at Basseux, to which Major Ashwell
name: Real College Essays

text: went as Commandant and expounded the art of war to young Subalterns and others, taking with
name: Real College Essays

text: him 2nd Lieut. Hopkinson as his Adjutant. Whilst Major Ashwell was away, Capt. Turner took
name: Real College Essays

text: over the duties of Second-in-Command, leaving B Company in the capable hands of Lieut. G. Wright.
name: Real College Essays

text: At an Assault Competition arranged by the Brigade School on October 12th, we almost swept the
name: Real College Essays

text: board, winning five out of eight events--Physical Drill, Bayonet Fighting, Bombing, Relay Race,
name: Real College Essays

text: and Obstacle Race--so we were well satisfied with our efforts, and the training work that was
name: Real College Essays

text: being done. By this time the whole Battalion had been fitted out with the short rifle, the
name: Real College Essays

text: last of the old long rifles being handed to Ordnance on September 26th.
name: Real College Essays

text: A new "toy" that was issued in these days was that horrible thing known as the "Lewis Gun Hand
name: Real College Essays

text: Cart." Tomlinson had some most entertaining experiences in trying to get mules to pull these
name: Real College Essays

text: handcarts, but the mules usually found it more interesting to try and turn round to see what
name: Real College Essays

text: extraordinary things on wheels they were now being insulted by being asked to pull, or in going
name: Real College Essays

text: off at breakneck speeds to try and get rid of them. These carts were never popular, and never
name: Real College Essays

text: a success, and gradually, by being carefully "left" by the roadside or some other convenient
name: Real College Essays

text: spots, they were eventually disposed of.
name: Real College Essays

text: The most notable event during this period was undoubtedly Vann's raid, the first really successful
name: Real College Essays

text: raid carried out by the Battalion. This took place on the night of September 21/22nd, and was
name: Real College Essays

text: carried out by Capt. Vann, with practically the whole of his (A) Company. In order to illustrate
name: Real College Essays

text: the thorough manner in which the scheme was devised and carried out, the story is given in
name: Real College Essays

text: some detail.
name: Real College Essays

text: The point to be raided was a short sap known as "Italy Sap," running out from the Boche front
name: Real College Essays

text: line about 300 yards away. The wire protecting the sap was cut during the afternoon of September
name: Real College Essays

text: 21st by our 2-inch trench mortars, and other gaps were cut on another part of the front further
name: Real College Essays

text: North, partly as a "blind" and partly for use in a future operation. In order to verify that
name: Real College Essays

text: the gaps were properly cut, a wire patrol under L.-Corpl. Hickman went out at 8.0 p.m. and
name: Real College Essays

text: reported that the gaps were good, and that the ammonal tubes which the Royal Engineers had
name: Real College Essays

text: in readiness to take out and blow gaps with were not required. Frequent bursts were fired by
name: Real College Essays

text: our machine guns on to the gaps to prevent them being repaired by the enemy before the raiding
name: Real College Essays

text: party got there. At 11.15 p.m., the wire patrol again went out and laid tapes from the gaps
name: Real College Essays

text: back to "Cavendish Sap" in our own front line to guide the raiding party across No Man's Land.
name: Real College Essays

text: The party was divided up into several smaller parties, commanded respectively by Lieut. Martelli,
name: Real College Essays

text: 2nd Lieuts. Duff, White, and Hall, and Comp. Sergt.-Major G. Powell. In addition there were
name: Real College Essays

text: two teams of Brigade machine gunners to guard the flanks, and seven sappers to blow up dug-outs.
name: Real College Essays

text: The total of the party was five Officers, and 136 other ranks. All identification marks, badges,
name: Real College Essays

text: letters, etc., had been removed from all members of the raiding party, and faces, hands and
name: Real College Essays

text: bayonets were blackened. Smoke helmets were carried in the pocket, and gas and phosphorus bombs
name: Real College Essays

text: were taken for clearing dug-outs, together with a number of flashlights and torches. At 12.15
name: Real College Essays

text: am the enemy trenches in the region of the area to be raided were bombarded by 18 pounders,
name: Real College Essays

text: 4.5 and 6-inch howitzers, 2-inch trench mortars, and 3-inch Stokes mortars. The raiding party
name: Real College Essays

text: guided by the tapes, got as close up to the barrage as possible, and as soon as it lifted at
name: Real College Essays

text: 12.28 a.m., went through the gaps and into the enemy trenches. One German who was met was at
name: Real College Essays

text: once bayoneted. Several dug-outs were bombed, and in some cases set on fire, one being blown
name: Real College Essays

text: up by the Royal Engineers with an ammonal tube. An enemy machine gun which opened fire from
name: Real College Essays

text: the right was immediately silenced by our Lewis and machine guns. The time fixed for the return
name: Real College Essays

text: of the party was 12.50 a.m. and it was only in the last minute or so that the main object of
name: Real College Essays

text: the raid, a prisoner, was secured. Most of the dug-outs were empty, but eventually Vann found
name: Real College Essays

text: one which contained some Boches. These he at once ordered to come out. Two came up with bayonets
name: Real College Essays

text: fixed, one of whom was at once shot dead by Vann, and the other wounded. They were followed
name: Real College Essays

text: by four others, including a stretcher bearer, who came out with hands up shouting "Kamerad!"
name: Real College Essays

text: Kamerad! They were at once hustled out of the trench with the scantiest of ceremony and brought
name: Real College Essays

text: back to our lines. Immediately after this, Vann ordered his bugler to sound the recall signal,
name: Real College Essays

text: and at the same instant the prearranged signal of six red rockets went up at Battalion Headquarters.
name: Real College Essays

text: During the last ten minutes of the raid the enemy had surrounded the occupied portion of the
name: Real College Essays

text: trenches with red lights and their artillery had begun to shell their front line and "Italy
name: Real College Essays

text: Sap," but did the party little harm, and every man got back to our trenches, the only casualties
name: Real College Essays

text: being eight men wounded. The net result of the raid was that five Germans were killed by the
name: Real College Essays

text: raiding party, and five taken prisoners, including one wounded, apart from any casualties inflicted
name: Real College Essays

text: by our bombardments. It is worth noting that a bombardment of the area around the blind gap
name: Real College Essays

text: was also carried out, and that the barrage there "lifted" before that on the gaps where the
name: Real College Essays

text: raid was actually to take place. This was undoubtedly of great assistance to the raiding party
name: Real College Essays

text: in diverting the enemy's attention, and in causing his barrage to come down first in No Man's
name: Real College Essays

text: Land opposite the blind gap, where we had no troops whatever. The number of rounds used to
name: Real College Essays

text: cut the wire was 670, fired by seven 2-inch trench mortars.
name: Real College Essays

text: Many messages of congratulation were received on the success of the raid, including one from
name: Real College Essays

text: the Corps Commander. It was a great pleasure to all when it was known shortly afterwards, that
name: Real College Essays

text: Vann, whose gallantry knew no bounds, had been given a bar to his M.C., and that the M.C. had
name: Real College Essays

text: been awarded to Duff, who had already done most admirable work at Vimy, and was one of the
name: Real College Essays

text: pluckiest Officers the Battalion ever had. Vann was subsequently awarded the French Croix-de-Guerre.
name: Real College Essays

text: Much of the success of the raid was undoubtedly due to the excellent patrolling which had been
name: Real College Essays

text: done by Martelli and his Scouts, L.-Corpl. Hickman, and Pvtes. Bambrook and Haslam, who throughout
name: Real College Essays

text: worked with the greatest skill, and left nothing undone to ensure that all was in order. Many
name: Real College Essays

text: gallant deeds too, were performed in the enemy trenches. Pvte. Chappel, a leading bayonet man
name: Real College Essays

text: successfully shewed one Boche the proper way of making the point; Pvte. Walsh wanted to go
name: Real College Essays

text: on to the German second line when he was unable to find any to kill where he was; Drummer Heath
name: Real College Essays

text: shewed great bravery and devotion as he had often done on previous occasions, in carrying messages;
name: Real College Essays

text: Drummer A. L. Smith, though wounded, remained at his post to the last to sound the recall signal;
name: Real College Essays

text: while great gallantry was also shewn by Lieut. Martelli, Comp. Sergt.-Major G. Powell, Sergt.
name: Real College Essays

text: Slater, Corpl. Carrier, and Pvte. Needham. The raiding party had a special little dinner of
name: Real College Essays

text: their own a few days after the raid at the canteen at Bailleulval.
name: Real College Essays

text: There is but little to record of our other doings in the trenches. We recall efforts being
name: Real College Essays

text: made to have "Daily Trench Exercises" carried out, such as physical jerks, bomb throwing, and
name: Real College Essays

text: rifle practice, but the orders issued on the subject were, we fear, honoured rather in the
name: Real College Essays

text: breach than the observance! We did, however, appreciate the opportunity given us in these days
name: Real College Essays

text: of sending Officers from time to time to our Gunner friends to learn something of the elements
name: Real College Essays

text: of artillery work, and though these visits were very short, it was certainly not the fault
name: Real College Essays

text: of the Gunners if we were not wiser for the instruction they gave us. We on our part were also
name: Real College Essays

text: called upon to do some instructing, having attached to us at various times Lieut.-Col. Smeathman
name: Real College Essays

text: of the Hertfordshire Regiment, Lieut. Haslam (afterwards killed) and 12 men of the Artists'
name: Real College Essays

text: Rifles, and an Officer and 14 men of the 1st King's Dragoon Guards, to all of whom we imparted
name: Real College Essays

text: as much of our knowledge of trench warfare as was possible during the short time they were with us.
name: Real College Essays

text: As time wore on changes took place. Vann, who had once more been slightly wounded during his
name: Real College Essays

text: raid and was not very fit, went to the Senior Officers' Course at Aldershot, and was succeeded
name: Real College Essays

text: in command of A Company by Capt. E. M. Hacking. Capt. Davenport after a week's tour in the
name: Real College Essays

text: trenches for instruction left to attend the Staff Course at Cambridge. Hicks, who was afterwards
name: Real College Essays

text: killed, went to the Trench Mortar Battery, E. A. Huskinson to the 138th Brigade to learn Staff
name: Real College Essays

text: duties, Easterfield to the Machine Gun Corps, where he won the M.C., Corry (who later died
name: Real College Essays

text: of wounds) and Newton to the Royal Flying Corps, Woodward to the "Whizz-bangs," and Capt. A.
name: Real College Essays

text: Hacking (from Brigade Headquarters), Field, Parker and Wells were invalided to England. Jones,
name: Real College Essays

text: who followed Marshall as Intelligence Officer, got wounded on patrol, and was succeeded by
name: Real College Essays

text: Martelli. Under the new scheme of sending home as Instructors, Warrant Officers and N.C.O.'s
name: Real College Essays

text: who were feeling the strain of long periods of active service, we lost Comp. Sergt.-Major Chappell,
name: Real College Essays

text: and Sergts. L. Bell, Shore and Wells. Comp. Quarter-Master-Sergt. Hotson then became Comp.
name: Real College Essays

text: Sergt.-Major of B Company, and Sergt. Deverall, Comp. Quarter-Master-Sergt. of C Company. Our
name: Real College Essays

text: casualties during the period amounted to seven killed, and 37 wounded. Against these losses
name: Real College Essays

text: we were joined by two Officers, 2nd Lieuts. J. M. Johnston, and E. W. Warner, and about 80
name: Real College Essays

text: men, including 40 from No. 4 Entrenching Battalion.
name: Real College Essays

text: All this time the Somme fighting had been going on, more or less successfully, and we wondered
name: Real College Essays

text: time and again when our turn would come to go and take part in it. Divisions around us were
name: Real College Essays

text: moved backwards and forwards, to and from the fighting area, with almost lightning rapidity,
name: Real College Essays

text: and still we were left in this peaceful part with few cares, and almost began to think we had
name: Real College Essays

text: been forgotten, or that the office boy had scratched our name off the list of Divisions in
name: Real College Essays

text: France! But it was apparently not so, for on October 20th, we got news of our approaching move
name: Real College Essays

text: to a training area, preparatory, no doubt, to taking a more active part in the fighting. Eventually,
name: Real College Essays

text: on October 29th, we were relieved by the 16th Manchesters and said goodbye to that delightful
name: Real College Essays

text: area where we had such good times, and to which we shall always look back with the greatest
name: Real College Essays

text: possible pleasure.
name: Real College Essays

text: Having spent the afternoon of October 29th in packing up, we left Bailleulval about dusk, and
name: Real College Essays

text: late the same evening arrived at Warluzel, where we spent the night in indifferent billets.
name: Real College Essays

text: We proceeded the following day to our old quarters at Le Souich, where we rested for 24 hours,
name: Real College Essays

text: continuing the march on November 1st to Neuvillette, and on November 3rd, to our final destination
name: Real College Essays

text: Maison Ponthieu, in the Third Army (St. Riquier) training area, having completed a march of
name: Real College Essays

text: something like 40 miles.
name: Real College Essays

text: Considering that this area had been used for training for some considerable time, we cannot
name: Real College Essays

text: say that we found the billets of the best or well provided with those comforts, which one might
name: Real College Essays

text: reasonably expect for troops out of the line preparing to take part in an offensive. Our energies
name: Real College Essays

text: at first were therefore concentrated on trying to make ourselves comfortable, and a considerable
name: Real College Essays

text: time was spent in carrying out improvements, making bathing arrangements, cookhouses, canteen
name: Real College Essays

text: and reading rooms. Rightly or wrongly we were inclined to think that we were unlucky with regard
name: Real College Essays

text: to billets, as we so often found ourselves scavenging and cleaning up other people's refuse.
name: Real College Essays

text: Doubtless every other unit thought the same. In the way of entertainments we had little or
name: Real College Essays

text: nothing, and Maison Ponthieu itself boasted nothing more than one or two estaminets. Auxi-le-Ch?teau,
name: Real College Essays

text: the home of the Third Army Training School, had a few shops and was rather more lively, while,
name: Real College Essays

text: for those who could get there, St. Riquier was quite interesting, and the battlefield of Cr??cy
name: Real College Essays

text: was not far off. Abbeville some distance away, was patronised only by a few lucky ones.
name: Real College Essays

text: We stayed in this area for nearly three weeks, and trained hard with a view to taking part
name: Real College Essays

text: in the Somme offensive. The chief points were to make everyone fit, and to practise formations
name: Real College Essays

text: for open warfare. For the former, recreation of every kind and for all ranks was an essential
name: Real College Essays

text: part of the programme, though we were inclined to think that perhaps a little too much compulsion
name: Real College Essays

text: was added to this part of the scheme. Inter-platoon football matches were a prominent part
name: Real College Essays

text: of the recreational training, and created a great deal of genuine interest and amusement. There
name: Real College Essays

text: were also inter-battalion football matches in the Division, in which we started well by beating
name: Real College Essays

text: the 7th Battalion, but were hopelessly defeated by the 5th Battalion at Noyelle on November
name: Real College Essays

text: 18th, by eight goals to nil. One of the most entertaining matches was that which took place
name: Real College Essays

text: at Maison Ponthieu, between Divisional Headquarters and Brigade Headquarters. When the Divisional
name: Real College Essays

text: goal was threatened S.O.S. rockets were sent up and smoke bombs let off, which to the onlookers,
name: Real College Essays

text: seemed rather to baffle the defending goalkeeper, who was none other than the Assistant Provost
name: Real College Essays

text: Marshal, Major Newbold! Preliminary contests held to select representatives for the Divisional
name: Real College Essays

text: Boxing Championship, which unfortunately did not materialise, were won by Sergt. Slater, Sergt.
name: Real College Essays

text: Attenborough, Signaller Gearney, and Pvte. Hall.
name: Real College Essays

text: For open warfare we practised mostly the attack, beginning with artillery formation. Those
name: Real College Essays

text: who did know something of it had by now grown very rusty, after so many months in trenches,
name: Real College Essays

text: whilst many Officers and men in the Battalion at this time, had had practically no training
name: Real College Essays

text: at all in this kind of warfare, so that much work was required in the simple practices of shaking
name: Real College Essays

text: out into artillery formation, lines of companies, half-companies, platoons or sections, and
name: Real College Essays

text: eventually extending for the final stages of the attack leading up to the assault. The other
name: Real College Essays

text: main feature of the training, was practice in night marching on a compass bearing and subsequent
name: Real College Essays

text: deployment for attack.
name: Real College Essays

text: On the whole we must confess we felt that the training was rather overdone. We had to put in
name: Real College Essays

text: many hours daily, and the march to the training ground at Yvrencheux and back, some six miles
name: Real College Essays

text: in all, was to say the least of it somewhat tedious. We were besides, most unfortunate with
name: Real College Essays

text: regard to weather, which was very unpleasant most of the time, and we were hardly sorry when
name: Real College Essays

text: our time came to leave the area. We were not, however, required to take part in the Somme fighting,
name: Real College Essays

text: as this had by now more or less worn itself out. From what we read and heard from troops, who
name: Real College Essays

text: came out of it, of the appalling condition of the ground and the impossibility of making any
name: Real College Essays

text: further progress during the Winter, we were not surprised or sorry that there was no need for
name: Real College Essays

text: us in that direction. Our lot was to return once more to our old trenches at Foncquevillers.
name: Real College Essays

text: Changes in personnel during this period were mostly in Officers. Major Ashwell had rejoined
name: Real College Essays

text: and resumed his duties as Second-in-Command; Major Lane also rejoined after nearly 18 months
name: Real College Essays

text: in England, as a result of his wound at Kemmel, and took over A Company from Capt. E. M. Hacking.
name: Real College Essays

text: A further addition was Lieut. Simonet, who had by some means managed to get the Hospital Authorities
name: Real College Essays

text: to pass him fit again for general service. We also had a small draft of 32 men. On the other
name: Real College Essays

text: hand we had to part with six Officers at extremely short notice to the 12th Rifle Brigade and
name: Real College Essays

text: King's Royal Rifle Corps which had lost very heavily in the Somme fighting, and sent 2nd Lieuts.
name: Real College Essays

text: Ranson, Hall (who later won the M.C.), Visser, H. G. Kirby, Byrne and Bailey (afterwards killed).
name: Real College Essays

text: Second Lieut. Cox also left us to join the Signal Company of the 14th Division, his place as
name: Real College Essays

text: Signalling Officer being taken by Lieut. Warner. For good work on a subsequent occasion Cox
name: Real College Essays

text: was awarded the M.C. Lieut. Martelli was still Intelligence Officer, Lieut. White, Grenade
name: Real College Essays

text: Officer, and Lieut. Tomlinson, Lewis Gun Officer.
name: Real College Essays

text: We went by easy stages back to the line, leaving Maison Ponthieu on November 22nd, and proceeding
name: Real College Essays

text: to Bealcourt, and the following day to Neuvillette. The chief item of interest in our two days'
name: Real College Essays

text: stay there, was a revolver shooting match between teams of Officers from our own and the 7th
name: Real College Essays

text: Battalion, in which we were badly beaten. On November 25th, we marched to Humbercourt on a
name: Real College Essays

text: pouring wet morning, arriving there about mid-day drenched to the skin. Here we stayed for
name: Real College Essays

text: nearly a fortnight, training and cutting wood in Lucheux Forest. The weather was wet and cold,
name: Real College Essays

text: and as the village lay in a hollow, we got the full benefit of all the rain, and consequent
name: Real College Essays

text: flooded streams. On November 30th, we took part in a Divisional cross-country run, a part of
name: Real College Essays

text: the programme left over from the St. Riquier area. The distance was two and three-quarter miles,
name: Real College Essays

text: and we felt quite pleased to finish 6th out of the 13 Battalions running, our pleasure knowing
name: Real College Essays

text: no bounds at seeing C. B. Johnstone and F. Torrance finish well within the time limit, happy
name: Real College Essays

text: if breathless.
name: Real College Essays
